reviews.review: Very busy but nice. It's a nice place to be. Maybe a lil bit to much tourists, but you should visit it once you are in Lisboa. You find a lot of dealers here who try to sell cocaine and weed. Kind of strange. Portuguese police seems to keep theire eyes closed :D
Patricia Keenan . We did this visit by boat which is advisable as the view from the sea is lovely .I don't think you would see it properly by land.

Awesome view of river and city from top of tower. If a) willing to stand in line and b) willing/able to walk up the 93 circular step staircase to get up there. It's worth it! Though there isn't really much to see about the tower itself - the views are fabulous.

Nice experience. It was nice going there and learning a little more about the Portuguese history. However, you do need some physical effort to go upstairs. It was hot, so it was even more tiring. The stairs were slippery, ao watch your steps. Seeing Lisbon from up there was the best part of the visit.
Good spot for pictures. It's really nice with a good view and surroundings. You can take some pretty pictures, visit the garden not so far, go eat at the Pasteis of Belem.

Torre de Belem. You can buy the ticket on the door as well as enjoying the history inside the tower. There are 93 steps to reach the top of the tower where you can view the beautiful surroundings including the 25 Abril bridge.

Impressive building but long queues. We had a quick look at the tower whilst on a day trip to Belem. It's quite a walk to the tower as it stands at the "gateway" to Lisbon but is worth the walk to view the building. What isn't so good is the fiendishly long queue to get into the building. It was so long and didn't seem to be getting any shorter so we didn't even bother to try and get in. Maybe if you went early morning or later in the day things would be better. So as I say,by all means go there if you want a nice stroll along the river but don't expect any more unless you have time to burn.

Beautiful to look at. This is really just a lovely building to look t in a not particularly good looking waterfront. It is a small jewel

Beautiful but it takes a long time to visit. It ´s a beautiful place to see the riverside of Lisbon . The problem is the specific way to visit the tower. It takes a long time to see the upper side. It seems an elevator . Only few people go up and only when they all have gone down you can visit it.

Impressive structure. A great piece of history that is easily accessible. Well worth a visit.
It is located in a pleasant park on the banks of the Tagus River.

Nice to see. Worth the quick train ride to Belem and to see the tower. There are usually crowds but this is a quick trip out there and worth the stop. I would recommend going early in the morning to beat the crowds. . .

A grand building. Sadly due to time restrictions associated with our tour we did not get to go inside! The setting is nonetheless spectacular and the views of the exterior unrestricted. Pretty attraction. Worth the trip. We travelled by tram to the Belem neighbourhood and enjoyed the many sites including the tower. We enjoyed it from the outside as the line ups were long to get in. The many food and wine carts along the waterfront make for a lovely walk.

Set Sail. One of my favourite buildings in Lisbon ! Love the scale and Manueline style synonymous with Portugal. This great building served as a send off point for the explorers as welll as a beacon to guide them home. It also housed a prison and served as an armory. Sheer beauty.

History and beauty. A visit to the Torre de Belem is a must when you are in Lisbon, the views of the river are just amazing, and the history surround this place is magic. Despite being quite a climb to the top '93 steps' it worth every second.
Great to see. I did not go inside, but a great thing to see given the history. Belem is a great part of town to walk around and enjoy.

Famous landmark and worth seeing. Iconic building. The Torre de Belem is one of the most iconic sites in Lisbon. It is not far from the Monument to the Discoveries and the Mosteiro dos Jeronimos. Most visitors will want to see all three. It was built between 1514 and 1520 as part of a defence system on the River Tagus to protect the approaches to the city. It is essentially a cross between something like a mediaeval keep and a more modern weapons platform. It is architecturally striking. It is ornate, highly adorned with carvings. Inside the tower is an Audience Room, the Governor’s Room and a chapel but, even so, not a great deal to see. There are excellent views of the Tagus from the tower. The stairs steep and narrow so getting both up, and back down again, can take some time if there are a lot of people. Not suitable for people with mobility issues.Tip: Buy your tickets at the Mosteiro dos Jeronimos (if you are going there too) so as to save queuing.
Worth a visit. A must see if you go to Lisbon unless you have a 14 year old who is not bothered about historical monuments

Visit just the ojtside. We just visited the outside as were told the inside was nothing different and there was a long queue to enter. It's a beautiful place to visit if you are in Lisbon...not sure if visiting the interior is worth it!

Landmark. Right down by the river surrounded by quite a bit of clean and well kept parkland, a nice place to visit. Didn't get the chance to get too close or go inside (if that is even possible) but still a nice area to stroll around.

It was built between 1514 and 1520 on the Island of Tajo River to defend the port entrance. Today, the chalk-white tower against blue sky is a beautiful site to photograph. Across the street, you will see Mosteiro dos Jeronimos. Do not miss it when you visit Lisbon.

A beautiful and iconic building that you need to see for yourself. Well, we did not visit the inside, I'd rather write it first so that no one reads this and feels disappointed. We walked around the building which is really beautiful and we read about a few historical facts that are available in Portuguese, Spanish and English in various places around the tower. Iconic Site of Lisbon. The Tower of Belem is an excellent historical site to visit. How to get to Tower of Belem from downtown Lisbon. Here is a guide how to visit the Tower of Belem by a combination of tram and foot from Lisbon downtown. The visit can be easily combined with other Belem sights such as Padrão dos Descobrimentos, Jerónimos Monastery, or Centro Cultural de Belém.1. Buy a multi-trip ticket for bus and tram: You will likely be using a tram or bus a few times while in Lisbon. Putting some money onto a card to pay for each trip is likely the most economical and practical options. When paying with the smart card, tickets are 1.25eur each, while tickets purchased from the driver are more expensive. Vending machines and sales counters can be found from the metro stations. The options of putting money onto the card is called "Zapping". Note, vending machines do not accept foreign credit cards. When putting money onto the card, the vending machines accept notes only, no joins (yes, it's, strange). Use the smart card inside the bus or tram to buy a ticket. Simple put the card in front of the card reader and wait until it shows a green light. The card reader also shows the remaining balance on the card. 2. Downtown to Tower of BelemTake tram 15E from Place Figueira / Rossio or Place Commercio to stop Pedrouços. This stop is like 2 stops after the Jerónimos Monastery. Walk down the street towards the sea, with the large compound of the Hotel Palácio do Governador to your left side. Then turn left for 50m to reach the pedestrian bridge to cross the railway line. The Tower of Belem can already be seen some 200m ahead.3. Return or continue to Padrão dos DescobrimentosThere is a cafe with pleasant seating behind the tower, if you need a break. -Return the same way, or continue to the Padrão dos Descobrimentos. This sight is some 500m walk along the river banks, upstream (direction away from the open sea). Note, you can not walk along the shore line, but you need to circumvent the yacht harbour. From Padrão dos Descobrimentos return via the same pedestrian bridge, or continue parallel to the shore line up the Belem railway station where the next pedestrian bridge can be found. The latter bridge connects to Jardim Afonso and from there it is an easy walk to the Jerónimos Monastery.
Beautiful scenery. The tower of Belem is a jewell of manuelin style. The view over Teju is also very nice. Bring a camera and try to make the best photo 😊

Fun, but not spectacular and rapidly overfilled with tourists. Torre de Belém is a fun place to visit, best on days when it won't be too crowded. There are a few old guns inside but other than that, it's mostly the views on the river that can be enjoyed here. It's a bit out of the way, though, and not greatly located near a major freeway. Best when combined with a (medium-long) walk to another Belém site.

Sightseeing Walking tour . The history behind this tower and the incredible architecture was a real pleasure. Im so happy to have stopped there. The view from the top of the tower was AWESOME! We could hear a man sing from below in the park. Loved that ambience!
interesting building. Is a very interesting building. If you want to visit this place you can do but will be lots of people trying to get inside.
Must go.. Since Lisbon is not like Paris where you have tons of places to go, you must go to this place. Is pretty nice and close to other attractions.

cruise first stop . wile in Lisbon we took a trip around the city on a hop on holiday off bus tour for 25 euro it was fantastic value for money. at the end we stopped of at Belem what a great looking building awsome backdrop to the 25 design April bridge. we went in we was lucky no cues. It's like a TARDIS it doesn't look that big from the outside. we went all the way to the top of the tower got some great photos from up there. But do be warned there is only one spiral staircase going all the way up and it does get crowded.so if your ever in Lisbon do visit Belem Tower you won't be disappointed

Great Views in Belem. The tower is several blocks from the Monsteiro so since we were in Belem early (and both attractions do not open to 10), we walked to the Tower first and stood in line. Despite there being no signs, you buy the tickets inside the tower. You’re able to walk around inside the tower, but the main attraction is when you start climbing up to see different vantage points. At one point, there is a narrow spiral staircase (of 93 steps) to get to the very top. It’s single file line to go up and down on the same staircase. I got a little claustrophobic, so I didn’t go all the way to the top. After about two flights of stairs, there’s a little platform where you can stop and see more views. There is a clock on each level that displays if you can go up or down the staircase during the next 3 minutes. This timer allows people to go up and down the staircase. Hence, why there is a limit to the number of people who can go the top of the tower. Which is why I was glad that we got there right when they opened b/c the lines could get long. I liked the Tower and the different views you can see. We bought the combo ticket at the Tower – which saved us time and money when we arrived at the Monsteiro.
Photo genic . A must see if you visit Belem. The tram journey from Lisbon was a bit sardine in a tin. It's very touristy hard to get a photo without people obstructing the view.
Long wait. The long waiting line for the tower makes this visit only moderately worth. If you're short on time I would skip this visit
Not much to see. There is a nice view of the ocean but thats about it. If you are in Belem you can visit it, but i wouldnt recommend making a special trip just to see it

Very nice place. Belém is a very nice place to visit, you can take the Electrico 15E at the praça da Figueira directly to Belém. Here you have to taste the original Pasteis da Belém!Cross the Praça the Imperio and walk to the Padrão dos Descobrimentos. A very impressing monument! From the top you have a nice vew on the Torre the Belém. The Torre de Bélem is closed on monday!A walk along the Doca de Bom Sucesso is a beautiful experience at a sunny day!
Great. So nice part of Lisboa . Just walk near the sea and watch beautiful view don't forget to drink something near the sea

Interesting sight during a day of sight seeing.. Wasn't able to go in, but maybe because it was a Monday and most attractions are close on Mondays so we just took in the view. Beware of the "selfie stick" sellers and the scarf sellers. Not sure if its a scam or pick pocketer's or not but they are all over the property here.
Nice looking building but long queues.. Get a yellow bus or boat or do it on the cheap by tram 15 from central square in town. The tram was packed and really hot.

A symbol of Portugal!. We visited the Torre de Belem after seeing Jeronimos Monastary and the adjoining church. We'd paid 12 euros each to tour the Cloister, which also included admission to the tower. The tower is a 10-15 minute walk from the monastary, through a park with benches, fountains and little old ladies selling inexpensive cork jewelry. We were sure glad we bought the Cloister tickets, because they also included admission to the tower. We by-passed 200-300 people waiting in cue for tickets!!`The tower itself was impressive and symbolic, as it was both a departure and welcoming home point for the great Portuguese explorers. Built in the 16th century, it has a commanding view west toward the Atlantic Ocean, as well as great views across and up the Rio Tejo. There are actually 3 sets of stairs, counting the set that leads down to what was most likely the powder room where they stored explosive charges. The next set of stairs lead up to the main view level of the tower, with a commanding 360 degree view of the surroundings, while the 3rd set leads up to the highest point of the tower. I'm sure glad we go to see it!

DECENT STRUCTURE. THE Belim tower is representative of Lisbon. But it was closed when we went there and you couldnt go up. the view around is great and the Parks surrounding the place are very Pretty.

Beautiful but crowded. It's beautiful from outside and worth the ticket to get in. We bought a combo ticket with the monastery for 12 euro and avoided the long waiting line. On a sunny day, it is very very hot. Make sure you have water with you.
Amazing!. The tower itself looks amazing! Didn't go inside because there was a huge queue but we took lots of lovely pictures. Perfect photo op, a must see if you're in Lisbon.

Beautiful to see. There was a huge queue here the day we visited so we made the most of the view instead, sitting on the waterfront on the steps taking it all in. We would of had to wait over an hour to get it which was disappointing and I feel it wasn't worth the long wait as its very pretty to look at from the outside.

Cool little tower!. Enjoyed our visit to the little tower. Lovely views from the top and great for photos. Queued for a while for tickets but as we were near the water it was pleasantly breezy. Also, buying a combined ticket here meant we skipped the queue when we got to the monastery afterwards!

A tower, however quite impressive. Over 500 year old tower, with a lot of history, the architecture itself is amazing and the view from the top is incredibly. It's defiantly worth a visit even if it is a little way out of Lisbon.

Lots of stairs but great views. As we had already purchased duel tickets at the Monastery, we went straight to the front. We had to queue around 20 minutes to gain access to the tall tower, but the views were incredible. I would warn people that there is lots of stairs and no handrails.
Sight seeing in lisbon. This is the highlight of the belem area and sits alongside a beautiful marina. You can also take the opportunity to see lisbon from the river. Well worth a visit
Beautiful Tower. Was lovely to look at. But unfortunately was closed. Said open til 5:30 but we were there at 4:30 during the week and no explanation. Disappointing
Iconic but Small. It's a must see on the Lisbon tour and makes for excellent pictures but it's small and doesn't take up much time and in the day.

One of Lisbon’s enduring images. This fortified tower at the western part of the City overlooks the river and is a very popular attraction. Belem is an area which sits about 6 km to the west of downtown Lisbon but has a number of places which make it worth planning a trip to cover them all in one day. I’d allow around an hour for the Tower itself and that you buy the combo ticket (about 16 euro) to this and other venues saving money. As it is popular remember that queues are likely – as are stairs if you decide to go in and climb for the view.
A steep climb. You need to know that it's 93 windy steps with no place to stop if you suddenly feel sick. Good only for the strong,
Visit of Tour. Very windy,very bussy. As it is the symbol of Lisboa,it is interesting to see. There are many tourists waiting to buy tickets.

Wonderful view of the tower. Went on an afternoon tour which showed us many sites including Torre de Belem very Majestic. We loved Astoril and the Cabo da Roca. Well worth the money for the amount of time spent. Beautiful tour of Sintra.

Stunning sight . While visiting Lisbon visited the tower which was built in the early 16th century. It is situated to balem part of town. The structure was built from lioz limestone and is composed of a bastion and about 30 metre almost four-storey tower.Amazing sights near the river and bridge. A must visit and try the egg tarts there. The best. The wind during winter can be very cold. Bring a warm jackets. A must visit in Lisbon.

Photo op outside. Didn't go up the torre, just took photos externally.
Nice walk along waterfront along to Discoveries Monument, Jerónimos Monastery & pateis de Belem.

Cool to See. Enjoyed this, but I think I would have rather done this in the off season as you had to stand in line inside to wait to go up in the actual tower. It was incredible hot that day, which did not make it enjoyable.

Best admired from outside. This is a really interesting and beautiful tower, but I can't really recommend queuing and paying to go inside. As the tower has a single narrow staircase the have to limit how many people can go up it which means lots of queues.

Nice but don't think you need to pay to go inside. We went to the tower since we were in Belem anyways and it is very nice (the Discoveries monument was being restored so we didn't see the Tower's counterpart). It is 6€ to go up the tower and I'm not sure it would be worth it, the view only seems to encompass the Ocean, which you get plenty of views throughout Lisbon and Cascais (if you go).
Beautiful spot to visit. It's a very popular place to visit, be prepared for many people around up to middle of September. But the view is gorgeous!
Centuries old site.... Turned to be a former prison. Nice! prison on the ocean shore... Wonderful views. Well maintained and attracts hundreds of visitors per hour.
Long queues. The very long queues to get into this tower are not worth the effort. After queueing to get a ticket, you will queue again to go to the top of the tower.
Harder to get to than getting into Hamilton in New York. Not sure what the big deal is, but it took over an hour to get there and then two more lines to get to the tower. Overrated.

Impressive. Though it is a bit far down the tram/bus line, it is worth a visit. The river setting is pretty. There are plenty of vendors and you can even sit outside enjoying a glass of wine while viewing the tower. Vendors sell cork souvenirs at good prices.

Iconic but almost too familiar. One of those places you have to visit and I am glad I did. However it is so familiar from pictures that it is almost an anti-climax to be there for real. It had a lot of scaffolding on when we visited which did not help. Glad I saw it but it wont linger in the memory for very long.
Very nice visit. As one of the top venues in Lisbon, we enjoyed our visit. We purchased a combined ticket and enjoyed the tower very much.
A "must see" site in Lisbon. . The Tower has been a landmark for centuries. It was once a defensive lookout in the centre of the Tagus.

History at First Sight. The Belém Tower is a living and everlasting link between past and present. The place encompasses centuries of history at arms length, one can breath the challenge of Portugal's brave men who made it to the seas in search of the new worlds. The tower points to the future of human discoveries in outer space. A testimony to the poetry of mankind's adventure.
Terror of Belem. We queued to get into the outer tower only to find an hours queue inside. Gave up! Too hot to stand there that long! No warning outside of the second queue inside!

tower in rehabilitation phase. During my holidays in Portugal, I went to visit some monuments. Sadly the Belem Tower is in rehabilitation phase... So I could take good pictures...But I'm sure very soon they will finish.

The Torre de Belem is historically important. We enjoyed visiting the Torre de Belem and learning the history. The queue for the movie was quite long, so we contented ourselves with the main tower and the lower level, which had been a prison during part of its history.

Beautiful Architecture . This is a beautiful fortification that looks like something out of Game of Thrones. It looks unreal in today's modern context. Well work a quick visit for a few photos. It's one of those sites where you can't take a bad picture.
Nice but boring. It's a castle in a nice location. Nothing more. Good for a photo but wouldn't stay longer than 10/15min. Very touristy.

Nice to look at. If you're having breakfast at the brilliant pasteis de belem then it won't harm you to step out to the Torre de belem for a couple of pictures. But don't go out there just for the Torre de Belem it's not that fantastic

Big tourist trap of course, but still a beautiful tower. The tower of Belém is worth the visit. We didn't go in, I didn't feel like waiting in line for at least 30 minutes. But it was a nice starting point for a walk to Pasteís de Belém (traditional custard cakes). I got in line for some Pasteís, my husband went to get coffee at the Starbucks next door. Across the street is a park, where we sat on a bench enjoying a little break. Note: You can take a seat inside at Pasteís de Belém, it is a beautiful old building. But it's a huge tourist trap and I hate standing in line for a table, then waiting for an uninterested waiter to clean your table and take your order and then wait again for a long time for some coffee and pasteís. I think we had the better deal, enjoying the sun in the park.

Must see. The Belem Tower is one of the most popular tourist attraction in Lisbon, so for sure you must see this. Is near to Jorenimos Monastery and you can buy ticket for both. Usually it is crowded but if you already have ticket from the monastery you go in easier.

Wish you were here. What a wonderful place Belem is the monastery worth the queue to enter and visit this wonderful place of God .Then walk a short distance to visit the magnificent statues with wonderful carvings around and the view from the top is magnificent especially on a warm day

Pretty small tower. Very attractive tower , with spectacular architecture. Nice enough to look around but only for about 15-20 minutes or so . I had a combined ticket from the monastery so walked in. If you had to queue for a ticket I'd have been less impressed. You could just look from the outside and take a picture and appreciate it still.

Nice to tick off being a UNESCO site, but I wouldn't go back. If I'm brutally honest, I thought this Belem tour was a tad overrated. Yes it's interesting and historic, but honestly, for the amount of time you may queue and even more if you want to go to the top of the tower, I genuinely didn't feel the wait was worth it. As Towers/ramparts or castles go, it's not aesthetically the most beautiful, the most interesting, the most significant or the most rewarding to explore, but overall, I'm glad I did it. It's ok if you've got an hour to kill in Belem, but I doubt you'll lose too much sleep if you don't get to see it, but that's just me.

Great views. Brief trip to Belem, main reason was to visit the Torre. Not disappointed. Bit of a wait to get in, but, don't be put off by this. Few steps to climb to access the top of the tower, views of the River Tejo at the top are worth it. A might visit.

Highlight of Bellem. Must see if you visiting this part of Lisbon, the walk from the monastery to the tower is quite good, even during peak summer there is enough breeze to keep self comfortable. The tower itslef sits magnificently on the sea. Makes for great photos.

Very beautiful. The architecture of the tower is exeptionnal, and you have a beautiful vue on the Belém quarter.. Be careful if you are afraid of water because you are surrounded by it ;-) Beware that this attraction close at 17h30..

Too much queuing. Too much queuing. You queue for your ticket (6€/per person). Then you queue again to be able to to queue again to finally go up 93 steps to the tower... and the view? Mediocre. It was nice... but not enough for what you had to pay and go thru to get the view.

Little gem. One thing about the Portuguese is that we used to do things in a smaller scale. Palácio de Queluz, for instance, is like a smaller Versailles. Torre de Belém is such a gem. When our man-of-war ships left for Africa and then India, the Tower was the last thing they would see after the mess and the departure. Many wouldn't never come back. Think of that when you climb the stairs of that beautiful and small monument..

Great scenic view. Especially at sunset you have a great view on the Tejo river, the 25 Avril bridge, the Vasco da Gama monument as well as the massive Jesus monument on the other side of the Tejo. There are some nearby museums and you can have a sundowner or a galao in front of Torre de Belem! Very recommendable!!

Lovely spot. When booking our trip to Lisbon we had been looking for things to do and places to visit. We took a day and called to see the tower and the monastery which isn't far away. The tower was a lovely place to visit with some beautiful views.

Nice but those crowds.... This is a beautiful five story decorative tower in the Belém area. We went here after lunch but the line up outside was immense but inside another big line up to go up the tower. That saddened us and just looked around at the main level. It is a beautiful fortress and well worth the visit.Word of advice, buy a triple ticket to see the Monastery, Archeological museum and the tower for €16.
In scaffold. Looks lovely, though I only saw it from the blue line yellow bus tour route! Loads of people around it.

Half an hour plus queuing time.. There's really not much to do in the tower. A pleasant, not great water view, a small shop, 93 steps up a narrow spiral staircase and take a few pictures and that's it. I think I spent 20 minutes at the most inside the tower. BUT added to the queuing time to get up to the top platform - probably three times that. I did NOT have to queue to get tickets either because I had bought a 3 for 1 combo deal at the archeological museum beside Geronimos monastery so it was "skip the line" for me at both monastery and tower. Probably saved me at least 90 minutes of queuing during the day.

Lovely view point but queues horrendous. You can't dispute it's in a great location. It was disapointing though to queue to get in, then queue to climb the tower and when you think you have got there queue again. We were told 25 minutes from inside. We didn't bother. It was too hot to be inside with lots of other people. So, go early, late or out of season. Still worth seeing though.
Island. A very unusual building, spectacular to look at. Ideal position for a fortress. Worth a visit, accessed via a wooden bridge.

Magnificent. Belem Tower is more like a very small castle than a tower or fort built to protect the people of Lisbon from attack . It has 6 turrets and some small towers and fancy galleries and a draw bridge by which to enter inside. There is a bulwark for 16 cannon and a dungeon so low you would not be able to stand up inside it but outside is much more captivating than inside. Most of the discovery voyagers left from here and there is a statue of Our Lady of safe homecoming watching for the sailors return on the outside and carvings of Saint Vincent and Saint Michael also.

Pretty box - good views. In Lisbon you soon learn to scale back your expectations and appreciate the simplicity of what it offers.The Torre is a good example - an interesting, pretty building. Inside there is a small area described as armaments storage and then there is a larger upstairs square. This is essentially a viewing platform and a holding area to climb the narrow stairs to the top. At the top there are views. That's about it! There are some nice touches in the stonework...

Lovely landmark. Not sure if it is worth standing in line to get your tickets as the inside isn't that special but if you buy your ticket at the same time as you buy your ticket to the monastery then you get in quicker. It's a good 15-20 minute walk from the monastery not 5 like they tell you.
visited while on red bus hop on hop off. torre de belem was intresting well explained lots of narrow steps. 150 only aloud in at any one time would be worth booking tickets in advance

Where has the feeling gone ?. It sure is a famous place, a small old castle offshore near to Lisbon. Brilliant. Yet it has been restored and refreshed and troughoutly cleaned, even the ancient prison cells are painted white and look rather pleasant. In one word, while approaching the site and coming close to the entrance it made me think of the Disney parcs ! Yet of course I paid a visit, the place is too famous to just let it alone when being around.

TOWER OF BELEM. After finishing the tour of Jeronimos Monastery and the Archeological Museum you come to the Tower of Belem. Outside the tower is better than the inside. You can see the places captured by the Portuguese sailors on a world map. Inside the tower is so narrow to climbe and there is a long line waiting to get the tickets. Worth to visit.

Beautiful Landmark. Torre de Belem is walking distance from the Monastery and like the monastery it pays to get there early to avoid lines. We had the advance tickets but the line was super long so we decided not to climb in and see the tower from the inside. The tower is impressive!

Beautiful . A beautiful place with a beautiful history, it's an amazing place to stay, have fun, walk, drink something with friends, near there is great restaurant called Portugalia, they have an incredible food actually. Talking about the place, it's a. Unique experience.
Good history and photo opportunity. It is what it is. Get a combined ticket with monastery of Jeronimho to minimise queues. Some lovely photo opportunities.

An unexpected bonus. We went to Belem tower. Very interesting history. That said, we came upon the monument to the Unknown Soldier of Portugal at the site. We happened to be there at the changing of the guard. Very moving experience. Plus, the memorial to those lost in foreign wars. The entire area is worth the trip.

Tower of Belem & Jeronimos Monastery . Just finished the tour of Tower of Belem and Jeronimos Monastery. Beautiful tower but what you see on the outside is more beautiful than the inside. I'm into pictures and that is how I experienced it. There are two lines to get through in the little tower: the line for tickets and then to climb the narrow tower to the top. Here is what we did to save some time. We went to the Archeological Museum (right next to Jeronimos Monastery) ticket booth to purchase the combo ticket for Jeronimos Monastery and Tower of Belem. We went to Jeronimos Church ( free admission) and then Jeronimos Monastery. Both are beauties for pictures as long as the crowds are under control. Buying the tickets in advance saved us the 1 hour wait in the first line of Tower of Belem. After that, when you make it to the first level of the tower, hope for an overcast sky and bring patience (~45 min) as you wait to walk up the tower for views that are nice but not a must. After this we ate at Nune's, a awesome seafood restaurant between the Tower and the monastery.
Beautiful surroundings. On a good day, it is nice to walk around Belem and visit Torre de Belem. Did not go inside due to long queue but walking around is good enough.

Nice and peaceful spot. Came for the photos, but didn't go up the tower. I would say just walk here after visiting the monastery and take a good picture of the tower with the bridge in the background.

Beautiful architecture and view. The tower is really nice and is a must see if you travel to Lisbon. That is where ships would leave from to go explore the rest of the world a few centuries ago. The view is beautiful.
Beautiful view. One of the must see sites in Lisbon. The view is absolutely beautiful! The exhibition downstairs might not be interesting to everyone though

Nice area. The whole belem area is nice and peaceful. You can enjoy a half day there if you have time in Lisbon. Walking along the river side. Enjoying the view with a minted lemonade or a glass of wine in hand. Go up the tour. Walk a bit to get to the docas and have lunch or dinner there

"We brought new worlds to the world". It´s a must see in Lisbon. This is the place where 500 years ago the Portuguese ships sailed out to explore the world. You cans stop and imagine what it was like at the time or just admire the lovely views over the river.
Lovely views. the tower itself would not be very impressive to me but the walks close by with cafes and bars and views of the harbor and bridge was very good.

Real history, real lines. What a stunning place but you have to make the effort to see it with all the crowds that flock there. Either buy a ticket in advance or try to go early. Head for the top of the tower first so you can get ahead in the second line.
surprise. jutting the midst of the targus river is this fabulous ancient tower. there was a really pleasant park next to it too.

Enjoy portuguese history. One of the must go places when in Lisbon. It's also very close to the Jerónimos Monestary. During sunny days you can go for pleasant walks alongside the river. There are restaurants in the area and you can grab traditional sweet pastries in "Pasteis de Belém".

Simple old tower. We did't stand in first queue since we had Lisbon Card, but next queue to top of the tower was a very hard due to sun beams. The tower is old but very simple. From my point of you there is no sense for stand about 30-60 min in queue for enter inside.

Worth a look (outside)!. This famous building is one of the signatures of Lissabon. It's a tower right at the river bank. We bought a combo ticket for entry to the Jeronimos convent and Torre de Belém. So we didn't have to stand in line again at the entrance. But once you're up to the main level, you have to stand a very long line to climb to the top and the rooms on the way. So try to go at impopulair times and days, so it's not so busy. It's definitly worth a visit, but not neccesarly inside. There isn't a whole lot to see and there are better views over the city. So if you don't have a lot of time, just taking a picture outside because it looks beautiful and unique. If you're facinated by medieval buildings and you have the time, go for it!

Beautiful building. So nice from the outside!We were too late to get inside, but as we go the tip from our friends inside it is empty. You don't have anything to see as it was abandoned long time ago. And queue is long.So, we were happy to see it from the outside, to go around it where possible.Calm place.

A historical place to visit. The view is beautiful with the River Tejo the Bridge Ponte 25 de Abril runs so nicely along with the humid summer , it does bring such a wonderful breeze.The organic ice tea along the sidewalk sweeps away the sweat. You could take a rest on the grass. There are some restrooms along which cost little money to get in.Take the tram to get back to the center once are tired and want some seafood lunch.

Pretty Location with lots of history. Not too long of a line to buy tickets for the tower as well as the Jeronimos Monastery. We enjoyed the interior of the tower, especially the view from the tower. 150 people are allowed at a time. We enjoyed walking around the location and the walk along the River.

Avoid unless you enjoy waiting in line!. I wanted to see the tower because it's a UNESCO World Heritage site and I love Gothic architecture. What I wasn't prepared for was the long lines on every floor just to reach the top. We tried to do everything correctly to minimize our wait. We went over the lunch hour (tour groups are eating)...we bought a duel ticket for both Jeronimos Monastery and Belem tower (at Jeronimos ticket booth.) The best part of our visit was walking in front of a long line of people waiting to buy tickets from only ONE open ticket booth at the tower. As we passed the long line we thought we were golden until we got in line on the second floor of the tower (standing in the hot sun)...the red/green, stop/go arrows are completely ignored, so chaos is on every floor there after. There is little information about the tower and floors and its completely frustrating as people cut in line, ignoring the go/stop instructions. We were nearly 1 hour in the hot interior of the tower waiting to get to the top floor. Also annoying were people who shouldn't be attempting to climb the steps, slowly going up while those waiting, saw the green arrows turn red! My advice is DON'T GO, unless you see no one inline or you love lines, otherwise bring the novel "War and Peace" so you have something to do!
Nice view. This place is nice but it's better from the outside, I got bored quing so much.Take a boat trip and see it from the water instead

Very average. The tower itself is OK. Looks lovely on the outside, but there is actually very little to see inside. View from the tower is nice, but I dont think it is worth waiting in a long queue and sometimes the queue is very long. You can buy a joined ticket to see the tower and the monastery as well. Cost you 12 euros. Do not take tram 15 to get to Belem. Take a train, it is much faster and less crowded than the tram.

Go to the top. Might be quite busy. To climb the tower expect to wait about 30 min or more. Narrow spiral staircase, but it's worth coming to the very top. Wait till the majority goes back to make photos

Beautiful Historic Monument. The monument and the surroundings is breath-taking with views of the River Tejo the Bridge Ponte 25 de Abril and the Cristo Rei (Christ the Redeemer) The monument itself is a work of art.Highly recommended visit to this piece of Portuguese History.You pay to see the monument inside but you can visit the outside free of charge.
Beautiful . Rent a bike and cycle down the whole way. It's beautiful and there are loads of things to see along the way

A must see!. The views from here are outstanding. Well worth the journey. After we toured the site, we had a nice little rest on the large grassy area just outfront of it. There will little stands selling juices and cocktails. It was a lovely way to relax after a busy day.

Pretty but Boring. Visited January 2016 - also previously December 2007.A pretty little fortress just off the bank of the Tagus.With a varied history/usage over the last 500 years, there ought to be a lot of information about this building. But no. The information boards relate mainly to the architecture rather than the history.The traffic light system to go up and down the tower staircase is ridiculous.A wasted opportunity and appears to be just a moneyspinner.I do not know why it is a UNESCO world heritage sight, as it does not appear to have played a significant role in Portuguese history.

Nice view but not worth the wait. We were lulled in to a false sense of security when we saw a relatively short queue outside that was moving reasonably quickly. What we didn't know was that inside was a significantly longer queue to get up the tour. They let people go in in large groups as it's only single file on the staircase in the tower.this means you end up standing in the sunshine waiting for anywhere from 20 minutes upwards. We waited about half an hour in the end and would be lucky if we spent that time in the tower. Its a nice tower with a great view but not really worth the effort.

IT'S BETTER TO SEE IT FROM THE OUTSIDE WHETHER TRYING TO ENTER. The tower BELEM is an impressive view, it was built on the 16th century as a Gothic style.I recommend not entering to the tower since the entrance line and every floor line will take you 1 hour up and down. All is because there is a limit of people that can enter to each floor.( the total is about 4 hours). To shorten only the entrance time, you should buy a ticket in advance.

Buy your ticket online in advance!. It savea you about an hour of standing the queue in wind and sun. It is definitely worth waiting because the tower is really wonderful but why not spending that hour with having a drink ;-)You have to stand the queue not only to enter the tower but also on almost every level as the space is very limited. Not recommended for claustrophobics, there is a very narrow staircase upstairs.The view is marvelous.

Beautiful . This is a beautiful building in a lovely town. There is a maximum off 100 people allowed in the tower at one time so it's best to get there early otherwise you can queue for quite a while. It's well worth making the short trip out of lisbon to visit this town there are so many things to do and see

A beautiful building . It is set in the sea, it was the first fortification on the river to protect Lisbon. It is very pretty. The views from the top are great. But there was a bit of a long queue because only 150 people are allowed in the building at once. There is also a replica shown close by.
Beautiful setting. Worth the trip out of the city centre, easy to get too using local trams or tourist bus. Nice area to take a stroll or relax

Wonderful architecture. This is an amazing tower that once was in the middle of the harbour but now sits at the shore's edge. It is a majestic tower that looms over the area and can be seen from a distance. Always a long line up to get in. We didn't wait and from talking to others we didn't miss much. But its a great thing to see up close.

Lisbon's most photographed monument. One of the most important monuments in Lisbon. Has been a strategic defence fort from discoveries times.Once inside Tagus river is now in it's coastal line.Try to visit at different times of the day, as you can get dramatically different photograhs.

A piece of history. The tower is small and very crowded, but definitely worth a visit. The view from the top is nice, you can visit the tour while doing a visit in Belem. I visited the tower in a Sunday, when the entrance was free, probably this is why it was so crowded.

Dear Lord The Queues. It wasn't just that the queues was outrageous, it was also the management of the queues that was shocking. Firstly there is a queue to get in, then there is a queue to get to a small stairs and then there is a queue to get to the other stairs. Then there is a queue to get back down the stairs! We are talking at least 20 minutes in each queue. I will let you do the maths. The staff managing the stairs all seemed seemed clueless at best. That being said, this is a stunning attraction.

A Must See Atraction. just visited this attraction a few days ago. Historic important attraction not to be missed .Located by the sea is a pleasure to walk & stroll the area. Has some vendors near by with the typical cork souvenirs. Food & places to snack right on spot.

Impressive building. Situated on the river Tagus, this is a cool landmark just to visit.
We didn't go inside I think it was €6.50, perhaps we missed out but was great wading up to it in the shallow sea and getting a drink at the cafe next to it.

Outstanding views, overwhelming crowds.. Try to pick a quiet time to go- we had to wait quite awhile to climb the narrow winding stairs up to the top which had a great vantage point. It was a bit claustrophobic with all the crowds of people...but
it is a worthwhile thing to see.

UNESCO world heritage landmark with a gorgeous view!.. I am an enthusiast of historical places and I enjoyed the visit to the Belem Tower a lot. From the prison in the basement to the top of the tower, it offers a glimpse of the past. The view from the top is breathtaking, especially on a sunny day, but to reach it first you need to get through a very narrow (and I do mean narrow) spiral stairs with 93 steps, and you need to do it fast. The stair is so cramped that it has room for people to either go up or down but not both, therefore there are signals to tell you when you can go in which direction (traffic lights if you wish). It´s worth it though. Beware, the tower is not that big so there´s a limit to the number of visitor that can be inside at any given time, this can lead to long waiting times. If it´s sunny bring an umbrella or you will melt under the Mediterranean sun while queuing. Speaking of queues, it gets really long if you´re buying your ticket there. We bought our tickets at the Museo Nacional de Arqueologia (a combi ticket that also included the Jeronimos Monastery) and that saved us a lot of time.

Only went to take pictures of the outside . We got there too late in the day to view the inside but it was still worth the walk up if you have been to see the monastery. You can get a combined ticket to see both.
Must see. I don't think many trip to Lisbon are compete without a trip to the Belem Tower. It opens at 10 so well worth getting there early to avoid massive queues.

Interesting building but daunting lines. The Torre de Belem was one of the sights we wanted to see in Belem. We walked there from the Monastery of Jeronimo crossing a lovely park adjacent to the Belem port. The building was impressive but the lines were daunting -- first to get into the Tower and then to get from the second floor to the upper floors of the Torre (after a considerable wait, we finally abandoned this effort so we don't know if it's worth the wait). The views of the port are impressive but can be seen almost as well from other locations in Belem. There was disappointingly little information provided with the various exhibits. In general, the attraction was okay, but not particularly memorable and with the downsides as noted.

Shame about the queues. The Torre was a beautiful and interesting monument, but from start to finish we were in a queue - to get through the door, to get to the roof, and then to get down again. We went at around midday, so possibly avoid this time to avoid standing around in the boiling sun waiting to stand around some more!

Beautiful building. This is one of the few buildings that was left standing after the earthquake in 1755. It is beautiful to look at against the blue water and sky. To walk up you have to pay around 4.6 euro and wait in a long line.

A part of town history . It has a good look as it stands in the middle of the water near one side of the river Tajo 'tagus'. There used to be two in old times each on one side of the river and high points to protect Lisbon from any aggression that might come through the river
Nice time. Our bus driver left us off giving us enough time to se the tower and walk the waterfront and still had time for a coffee . Highly recommend

Good views but avoid the queues. You definitely do not want to queue in the sun as you will be queuing longer than you are in the tower. Get your tickets before you go. There is not a lot in it apart from the views and getting a feel for the history

Beautiful sight!. The outline of this magnificent tower alone is stunning.
We tried to photograph it from many outside angles to show the
Workmanship. It is beautifully preserved and worth a visit...
Must see. Lovely little fortress defence with great views not much to see inside but fab views from the top be prepared to queue as limited amount of people allowed in at one time.
You must see this tower !. Don't go on Monday if you want to enter the Tower , because it's closed. This is a great place to rest and enjoy the view. Close to the water (some stairs) .

Very photogenic structure. This is an interesting little structure in an iconic location. I suppose that it would been even more impressive if it was as far from the shore as it used to be. There isn't a lot inside but there are some good views to be had over the Tagus. The queueing system is a bit odd but seemed to work when I was there, although it opened about 10 minutes late.
Symbol of Lisbon. We saw the tower from many different directions including from the river on a sailboat at sunset. This was our favorite view. The monument stands apart and is very photographic.

Plan plenty of time!. Try to Arrange your tickets in advanceAlso prepare to wait outside in the heat for long periods of time and lots of stepsIn general - nothing special but if you have 2 spare hours..

Just a quick trip. I always like to hit up the UNESCO World Heritage sites when traveling and this and Jeronimos Monastary are near each other. Certainly worth the trip out to see them. You'll also see a memorial to the first aerial crossing of the Atlantic Ocean. As an American, it made me chuckle that there are indeed other view points around the world.

Worth the boat trip. We caught the yellow boat tour and stopped off at Belem. It was very hot and there were long lines waiting to go in so we just looked around the outside.It is very well preserved and next door to the Military museum.

Hot queues . Have to say I was slightly underwhelmed. Hadn't pre paid so queued for 15 minutes to get in ,then for another 20 to go up to the tower as only 120 people can go up at one time. Hot and tired by the time we started the 93 steps up to the top. It was OK but don't expect too much.

Cool to see, but not worth the time.. The tower is a funny little structure that is interesting to look at, but it's not the easiest to get to. It's about a 10 minute walk from Jeronimo Monastery. It's definitely worth going if you are in the area. I tried to go in, but after waiting for 30 minutes without much movement in the line I decided to spend my time elsewhere especially since I stood in lone lines for the monastery. The inside may be very cool, but I have to say I'm happy with my decision to skip it, my time was better spent exploring other parts of the city.
excellent p;ace. excellent place to visit ,the history and the structure ,place was soo hot in August my family took a lot of pictures ,place is amazing......

Must see. This was a great visit, except for the long line, but it moves. The rooms are small and only so many people can fit. If you can't handle stairs, I wouldn't really try it. Once you get to the roof, the view is spectacular.

Nice but nothing special . The architecture is nice but it's not a very grand monument. We bought tickets to go up on top but there are 2 levels. To get to the very top there was a 45-50 minute lineup so we skipped it.

A nice tour of Belem. Torre de Belem is part of the a wonderful walking tour of Belem that offers great views of the harbor and river. The Tower can close fairly early, but is a must visit for anyone spending time in Belem.
Beautiful. Absolutely beautiful, particularly on a sunny day. A step back in time, a so worth it. Excellent photo opportunities, lovely park and nice restaurant nearby. Definitely worth a visit.
You can just watch it from the outside. The place (and all its surroundings) is beautiful from the outside, so don't even bother in getting in as you'll be in for a let down.

Don't expect to be amazed. As a landmark of Lisbon, it is worth the visit. The area where it is located is also very nice with the sea and park, but the tower itself is quite small and doesn't fit much into the modern location. It's nice to see but don't expect to be amazed.

A symbol of the Age of Discovery. This tower is actually on UNESCO’s list (didn’t know it) and that because of its significant role in the Portuguese maritime discoveries. The tower was built in 1515 to guard the entrance to Lisbon’s harbor, and is a prominent example of the Portuguese Manueline style. Beautiful and fairytalish, it’s one of my favorite spots in Lisbon.
Visit History. Our great history talks about Our discoveries. This represents this in its best, 3 monuments in a little space frame, all in diferent stiles and not good together.
Very lovely place and beautiful view. Loved the place with the eye soothing view. Loved the walk as well as the weather there. Its always lovely to learn about such places.

Amazing monument in Belem. We hopped off the bus at the Torre and enjoyed walking in the park, taking pictures, putting our feet in the water, and going to the cafe nearby. It's an amazing monument that is a must see.

One of the most beautiful Fortresses in the world. It has been built and designed by order of King Manuel l, of Portugal in the unique Manueline Style during the Portuguese discoveries period
It is a fortress but it was also a prison' and the house of the governor.
Definitely is worth a visit

Amazing history and great views. Visited in January, so crowds were not a problem. Had fun exploring and climbing the tower and reading about its history and function as part of the defenses of Lisbon. Really nice views from the top of the tower. Well worth a visit, especially if one is visiting Jeronimos Monastery nearby.

Beautiful tower. Nice tower in the water. Buy your tickets in advance and you'll waltz in otherwise you'll have to wait in line. It gets windy and can get chilly later on the afternoon. Also they close at 5 so beware so you won't miss it.

Very nice. Very cool historical site. Highly recommended. There is a lot of historical pieces in addition to tower, cannons, anchors, and the first airplane to cross the Atlantic. There are a lot of food and beverage options in the area as well as very clean public restrooms.
Beautiful. The most impressive castle and tower by the sea. Ideal for a romantic walk or just relaxing with friends by the sea.

Mayhem. I was concerned when the first sign I saw at the ticket office was directing us to the complaints book but it now makes sense. The first section you come to is ok for a few photos. You then have to queue and watch as 120 people come out of a narrow staircase in a hot room. There is some sort of system turning from green to red every 3 minutes but they seem to have decided not to use it. Once on the roof we spent about 30 seconds looking then started queueing to come back down. As soon as it went green we went down only to find several people were still coming up. This resulted in some people getting wedged in the stair case. We came back up then ran out as soon as we could. People were running in and out of the rooms to make sure they were out before it went red again. We heard one man saying 'let's get out of this place while we can'. I'm sure this could be improved.

Incredible view. I didn't think I was going to enjoy it as much as I did. I'm not really into going up the towers, roofs and etc to see the view (even though I do when I think it's worth it ). It was a lovely day when we were there and as the sun was slowly going down the sky had a beautiful color. You'll get nice pictures of the tower and from the there.

Not worth going to the top. The pictures around the tower are excellent and provide context for this emblem of Lisbon. Even near the closing time, it was packed and the security let visitors cutting the queue in frequently. The views were not worthy of the admission, save it for a glass of vinho branco nearby.
The super monument. A must see if you are in Lisbon, you can make beautifull pictures when the river is up and the tower stays in the island. I recommend you go up to see the river.

Belem tower. When in Lisbon, you should have seen this tower.The tower is part of the defensive system of the city and is located at the Tagus River. When you are on time, it is possible to enter the tower and climb it. We were unfortunately too late for this. At 17:00 the last people get access to the tower.But..From the outside it's also very beautiful to see. You have a nice view and you can shoot beautiful pictures.
A must see. This medieval tower is a must see in Lisbon! You have a beautiful 360 degree view from the top. It is a very cool structure with spiral staircase and little nooks you can explore.

Not worth the line to go inside . Granted we came in high season in August. We waited in a one hour line in the heat. The castle has 1 ticket taker! We finally got inside and the first floor had recreated cannons and precious little else. We waited on a another line to get to the tower. After watching 50 people exit a small entrance on the second level we were able to go in. The staging area was packed and had a line around the perimeter. He ushered us into the middle of the room. We asked how would we get in and got no response. After an interminable wait in the hot, close room he announced we could begin he climb. We tried to join the line and were screamed at by the people on the perimeter who felt we were cutting. After a skirmish we left frustrated and angry. We tried to get it money back, but the ticket taker and other officials were not sympathetic. If you go early or off season it is a beautiful castle with we assume great views. But if the line goes 100 yards past the drawbridge, just take pictures. By the way, this was only time in Portugal where we felt indifference from staff. The Portuguese people are kind and accommodating by and large.
Belem Tower. It is a very nice place to visit from the prison to the top - You can buy a combo ticket with Monasteiro do Jeronimos (you can save some euros)
Stunning but be prepared! . Amazing place. Stunningly set. But wow the queues to go in were horrendous! You could quite easily toast in the sun whilst queueing..

Absolute waste of time. We spent more time in line, than in the tower itself. It was quite boring inside. They could make it much more fun by adding some multimedia educational materials. The view from top didn't impress us too. Comparing with tower of cathedral in Sevilla, where we spent 30 minutes staring at the roofs with swimming pools, it was boring

This was not a good experience. Visited in August which is clearly the time to avoid. Had to queue for at least 45 mins to get in, which can be reduced if you pre-book.However, once you enter the problem is that there is a single staircase to climb up and down the tower. There is a system in place to both limit the numbers and control the flow of people. It doesn't work. You spend most of your time having to squeeze past people and wait in line to climb up or down the tower. Nice view at the top but really not worth the effort unless you visit out of season.

Scenic, historical UNESCO heritage monument. Its one of the important monument in Lisbon old , nice interior architecture and historic. Offers fantastic and scenic views. worth visit.There is a limit on number of people allowed inside. So it might take a while to get in if there a big queue. On 1st Sunday the entrance is free. We did not pay anything. Check Monday the monument might be closed.

Unexciting interior but nice views. Worth a look but can't say I found it very interesting as there wasn't much in the way of information available on site. There were nice views from the upper battery.

Secret. Best to visit this place on a Friday afternoon because there's hardly any tourists outside rather than Tuesday to Thursday there will be hundreds of people lining up to get in
Monday it's closed
So yes definitely Friday for those much loved landscape photos and selfies
Enjoy
Just a tower. It is just a tower. Very touristic and didn't seem to be that big. We didn't go inside and just saw it, standing in front of the tower.

One of the must sees in Lisbon. Torre de Belem is maybe the most famous sight in Lisbon and definitely worth seeing despite the crowd. The place where the monument stands is very beautiful and you get nice photos from there.
Nice monument. It's a nice monument with great view. In addition it's free with Lisbon card. You can get a ticket at jeronimos monastery to avoid the long queue
Impressive building. The tower is very impressive. Especially at the end of the day the light is beautiful. For me it is sufficient to see the outside only.
Nice building . The Torre de Belem was closed at the time we went, this is a unique stone monument beautiful tower well worth the time to stop and take photos.

Not so impressive. Inside is a very narrow and enclosed space. Maybe you better stay on the outside terrace and take pictures from there. The wind blows hard even in June so be careful with your cameras.

I guess it's a must see. There was a line up when we were there and we waited about 40 minutes to get in. Once in there's not much to see so all that's left to do is go up the stairs. Patience is a must since the stairs are very narrow, only one person gets by at a time. There are lights at each floor indicating when to go up and down so there's no problems but not everyone heeds them so inevitably you have to cross people in the staircase. Worth it to see the stairs.
Not worth it, going inside. We went to the top, but the stairs where very small and high, it was a bit caos inside. I recommend to visit from the outside only

Stressful snd unpleasant -AVOID if you can!. As soon as we entered (after a long initial queue) we instantly wished we hadn't bothered as the queuing system to reach the top is outrageous and very poorly ran. Very few people follow the instructions on climbing the narrow spiral staircase which causes delays and there were no members of staff in sight to help run things smoothly. As soon as we reached the top we had to instantly join the queue to go back down as it filled the top of the tower - you couldn't take any pictures or enjoy the views due to the ridiculous queuing/staircase system which needs to be addressed.Prior to this, we very nearly didn't buy a ticket after enjoying the view from the outside and we definitely wish we hadn't wasted our money on a ticket - in fact we feel like we should have been paid to go through that terrible experience. Overall stressful unpleasant experience and would recommend the view just from sitting on the grass outside of the tower.

FR Eiffel Touwer or GB Big Ben = PT Belém's Tower. This tower is a national symbol. If you visit Paris you must visit Eiffel Tower, in London Big Ben, in Lisbon Belém's Tower. Is connected with the Portuguese maritime discoveries from the 1400-1500 years. A place you must visit. No dangerous criminality but always be aware of pickpockets.
Great view into the river. From the top of the tower there is a great view into the river and the bridge. The courtyard has real old time atmosphere.
Unique. Unique monument. Worth visiting but be aware there is a line to get in, then can be an even longer line to get up to the second part of the tower (we gave up after 20 mins of not moving).

Not worth it. Had we not prepaid our tickets would have just viewed from the outside. Two queues to get in paying and prepaid neither moved that quickly. Once inside not worth it as other reviewers have said only 120 people allowed up to the tower at anyone time. Wasn't worth the wait or energy. Ok just to be viewed from the exterior you won't miss anything by doing so.
Great view and piece of history. Wow those winding steps up to of the tower can do your head in and love the automatic step system. The view is great and visited on a lovely blue day.

Nice view but not worth standing in the queues. Only 120 people let in at a time. Very tight staircase does not allow people to pass in both directions hence you have to wait for that 120 people to come down before you are let in. Equals to two queues at the bottom (out and inside on the tower) and another queue on top for people wanting to get down.... Torre de Belem- you are a victim of your own success. No capacity for the volumes. Views are nice but nothing special and hard to enjoy in very crowded area. I would not do again.

Nice Scenery & Nearby Cafe. We stopped for about 45 minutes at the site of the Torre de Belem. There were a lot of people queuing to get inside but we decided not to go inside. The area is quite picturesque with the tower next to the river, plus you can see the April 25th Bridge.There is quite a nice cafe nearby where you can order some food. I ordered the Pasteis de Belem which is one of the main specialities of the region and it was delicious. The area is certainly worth a visit for a short while.

part of caste in the water. I liked Lisbon a lot, spent one evening walking around Belem, and it is very nice part of city. There is not much to see from the tower, could not access it at the evening, but still nice place to sit down and enjoy the good weather and surrounding water.

Must see but be patient. We went around the early noon after the Jeronimous Monterrey.. Buy the tickets there and save the line.. Took a while to go up since it is limited to 120 ppl at a time. Takes 93The narrow spiraling stairs to reach the top and tower is very impressive and has a great view of Belem and the surrounding areas.. Also interesting to visualize the lives of the guards. Unfortunately we came during a day without the sufficient staff members therefore had trouble going down since no one was there to control the line, bit disappointing.

Not as tall as I thought. The Tower of Belem is located right on the water. This is another very popular tourist attraction in this part of town and therefore the lines are very long. When we walked up on the tower it was not as tall as I had perceived, and so I was disappointed and decided not to wait in the sun in the long line since we didn't have much time in Lisbon. I would recommend that you arrive early to avoid the heat of the day and the long lines. There is a beautiful view of a bridge and a Jesus Christ statue from the area surrounding the tower.

Overrated!. This was actually my main point of interest in Lisboa... and i was very dissapointed. Price, small and not too interesting.Cannons made of plastic, 20 minutes waiting just to climb 96 steps and see, what you can see from any point in Bairo Alto or Alfama? Not a chance - not any more. You can definatelly live without seeing this.
nice area but not worth visiting inside.. The tower is nice but I love the area better than the monument itself. it's located by the river and the view of the bridge is stunning.
Don't waist your time. You wait forever for no reason. See it from the outside. Don't waste your time or money. Long long long lines for nothing.

Great to see but long queues.. We visited in August during a day trip to Belém, so queues are to be expected however, it was over 30 degrees and the queue was long. We decided it was too much to expect our five year old to wait in the heat for us to see the inside of the tower.The outside is beautiful and worth going to see if you're in the area.Parking is limited and difficult during busy times.We walked on a few minutes further from the Tower and saw the war memorial which adjoins the war museum. A beautiful & moving tribute to those who gave their lives in Portuguese service.

Long queues just for a view. Really not worth it. The outside is quite enough. The inside in August is cramped, badly organised. Access to the tower was totally chaotic with a ridiculous red light / green light system to go up and down which didn't work at all. Really wish I'd just seen it from the outside!

Nice!! . We have decide not to go in the morning nor evening but at night. We had a car so it helped a lot. Quiet at night and also very nice. Worth to visit. Parking just in front. View on the christ and the bridge.
Great stucture !!!. One of the magnificent structure of portugal.You can actually enjoy the Belem cake here.This place surrounding with the park which makes the most suitable for family outings.
A step into the past!. Absolutely beautiful monument. There's simply something grand about the view of the Tower of Belem even before you enter it. Do not hesitate to go!

Good from outside, dont wait to get up the tower. Avoid the long lines...buy the Lisbon card for the day. It is good to get into, look around ..but PLEASE DONT WAIT TO GET UP THE TOWER. It is small passage, to reach a view point which is not really worth it. There are better view points in Lisbon

NICE AREA OF LISBON, TO SEE AND TO BE ONCE, LARGE QUEUE IN ORDER TO GET INSIDE !. My wife, our 10 years old kid and myself spent 2 nights in Lisbon in August 2016. We stayed in Torel Palace and took the Tagus Bus Tour in order to reach Torre de Belem area. The place is great, nice view and spacy, green all around, however, expect many many tourists in this area in summer and probably a huge queue to make in order to get inside the Tower. When we saw how big was the queue, we of course did not even started to do it, so we walked around the place, took several photos and enjoyed the museo de Combatente next to it. So, a place to see once in Lisbon, enjoy and have a look to my photos HD which I will soon post.
Belem day trip. Take the tram to belam as there is enough to occupy a day , carriage museum, monuments, pastel de nata original bakery
Very pretty tower from the outside. The tower is really picturesque and certainly worth visiting. The admission charge of €6 is a little steep, so viewing it from the outside is the way to go.

See it from the nearby park. We enjoyed it from outside. Around noon there was a very long line of tourists waiting to get in. We are glad we didn't subject ourselves to the sojourn in full sun. Thanks to other Trip Advisor commentators for advising us about the worth of entering. We loved being there to see this structure - from the shade in the nearby park.

Lovely looking attraction saw only from outside.. Got there too late to get inside so just saw from the outside. It was worth walking up to it though to get some lovely pictures and get a sense of history by being there.
flying in the sky. Located in the quay that's why looks like Torre de Belem is flying in the sky!)Magestic place - amply and exciting!

Nice to see, nothing to do.... As part of a trip to Belem it was worth seeing while we were there as it is a well known landmark and we can say we've seen it. The surrounding views of the estuary make it all the better. Other than looking at the tower and taking pictures, there was nothing further it could offer.
Go visit do not form the line - not worth. Nice place, interesting history just no reason to queue the line which is horrendous the wait. You can just about see everything on the outside part.
A beautiful monument. The tower of Belem is a 'must to see' if you visit Lisbon. A beautiful landmark that's a remarkable reminder of the Portugal Empire days. Well recommended.

Beautiful Historical Site. I didn't go inside because the line was far too long. With the right planning, an early visit would likely pay off. Gorgeous architecture, situated on a shallow estuary in the Tagus River; connected to the river walk by a walk-pier.

Belem a beautiful little tower but not recommendable on crowded days. A UNESCO patrimonial monument, very exciting read the history of the tower and imagine the facts that occurred inside it. The problem when i was there, the crowded in a little space. I would recommend try to visit on work days and no in vacations or holidays. There is a beautiful sight of Tajo river.

Great Place to visit.. Loved the view. Beautiful, clean and well kept area.
Took lots of pics. Worth bringing Camera.
One can easily spend couple of hours here.
Cutest little tower is a UNESCO site. The lines are horrendous throughout the tower. You can almost see as much from the outside. Narrow twisting staircases. NOT handicap accessible.
A long way out. The walk from the Jeronimos monastery to the tower in the heat of the afternoon is not advisable. The tower itself is nothing very spectacular.
Waiting in line... no thanks. Yeah honestly.... i wasn't ready to stay in queue for 2 hours to climb upon this monument. looks great though, worth a picture!

Great place!. Great place to go. Next to it there is a small beach where you can sit down and relax a bit for having walking so much. Inside the Tower you can go up and have a nice view, but I preferred to admire it from the outside.

Good views along the river. Worth the trip out and if you take the bus tour it is worth getting off to explore the area and get views over the bridge and the contrasting areas of Belem. Also only 15 minutes brisk walk from Pasteis de Belem.
VERY IMPORTANT – PLEASE READ. It’s very beautiful outside than inside. Don’t spend time on huge queue and 6 Euros / person to see inside.

beautiful. It is a really beautiful place at a picturesque landscape. If you're in Belem, you shouldn't miss this place. it's a nice stroll from the St. Geronimo Monastery. But if you have a limited time in Lisbon don't worry to much about missing this spot. It's beautiful but I think it's ok to miss it ;))
Beautiful and a must see in Lisbon. I went there in a windy day. The stairs inside are steep and narrow, but the view up there was great.

Nice Tourist Spot. It is a nice Tourist spot.We can travel by a city sightseeing bus to this spot.There is a long queue for the entry ticket. Nice location near water body.One should carry umbrella if it is sunny weather and a bottle of drinking water.

Beautiful. A beautiful piece of architecture, and when you learn the history behind it it becomes all the more impressive.
Definitely worth the visit.
Beautiful building from a great past!. This building is really a sight, while it served a military duty in its hayday, it is still a nice and historic building, a must see in Lisbon.

Torre de Belem is a MUST while in Lisbon. I've been three times to Lisbon and this place is in my heart. The tower is beautiful, this time it was under construction but it you are there go and see it.

An extraordinary beauty overlooking the Tagus River. When we were at Belem we could not miss out this magnificent tower which is a UNESCO World Heritage. It has elaborate decorations and is located by the end of the Tagus River. Its original role was a maritime control tower and defense at the entrance to the city and to oversee the galleons loaded with precious stones, porcelain, textiles etc... We had to wait to visit this tower due to the long queues but were not disappointed. A visit is a MUST at this glorious and splendid tower.
Not worth it to go to the top. The Belem Tower is beautiful to look at but not worth it to pay to go inside and go to the top. It takes a really long time due to capacity limitations.

Nice sea view and amazing constructions!. Lisbon is full of history! Torre de Belem is a part of the empire building that remains at the coast line soured of historic monuments from one of the most important discover country in the world early in the 1400-1500!

Excellent looking tower by the river Tagus. The tower had huge queues so we didn't go in but enjoyed views of it and the river estuary and the bridge and far bank and the sea to the right. Excellent location but be prepared for queues to get in.

Beautiful outside but not worth the long wait. Beautiful landmark castle from the outside with a nice view over the river Tagus. Inside not much to see, pretty simple and besides that you have to share the spaces with other people and they allow just a certain number of visitors per section so you sometimes run the risk of a long wait. Just go in there if there's not a (long) line outside I would say

Get the Ticket first !. Torre de Belem is a unique tower and must in Lisbon.I suggest to buy tickets already in Jerónimos Monastery, you can avoid enormous queue in front of tower. :) You can enjoy it also from a small park nearby when you can have a nice picnic.

Place that must be seen. One of the places in Lisbon that is worth to visit. The tower is located about 20-25 minutes by tram No 15 from the Cais do Sodre metro station. There is a nice green area around the tower and it is possible to find good place to seat on the grass and have great view at the tower. You can visit the tower inside, but the single ticket costs 6 Euro. The better option is to buy combined ticket for 12 Euro for visiting the Torre de Belem and Jerónimos Monastery.
Overrated. An interesting historical building but not worth going inside unless you have a lot of time on your hands.

Belem Tower. Beautiful view from the tower ( on each level 4) I do not recommend it for people with difficulty going up stairs cause there quite a few. But if you have no problems it is a beautiful tower with amazing views

Save time and don't queue for inside. This has lovely detail and is set just by the River. It is very busy, with a long queue. Going inside is really not worth your time. Take it all in from the outside and enjoy more Lisbon sights. It is close for the Hop on Hop off bus. There are also lots of sellers, be careful with pickpockets in the area.
Lovely monument.. Seen from the Belem blue bus tour, this is something we will return to explore at length in the future.

It's not a must to visit inside . Its a beautiful building, that's for sure. However it is not a must to visit inside that tower in my opinion. Its fairly small and doesn't have anything interesting, other than getting a fantastic view of the river and bridge from the top.

Not for the claustrophobic. A beautiful building and if you get the duo ticket from the monastery your can 'jump' the lengthy queue for entry. However, there is a timed system for getting up the staircase to the top of the tower itself and the staircase is very narrow. Not every one follows the instruction which can lead to jamming.
Not worth the time. If you have limited time in Lisbon spend your time in Alfama, Bairro Alto, Chiado or outside the city in Sintra. This is not worth the time and effort to get to.

OK. If you go to Lisbon, you are going to go to Belem, so you might as well go to the tower. It is not all that much when you get inside. I think walking along the waterfront in this area is very pleasant and enjoyable, so the tower is an excuse to get you out this far so that you can enjoy the riverfront.

A true tourist attraction. I'm sorry, but seeing well over a hundred people lined up to get in to see this tower which is all by itself on the shore of the bay was not for me. In addition to having to pay 6 euros to get in. I am sure it is beautiful inside, but we have seen many other beautiful things in Portugal and this seems to be a big tourist trap to me. Just walk through the Alfama and you will see many other beautiful things for free!
GREAT VIEW. We visited Jan. 2016. Weather was cloudy and windy so view was amazing. Museum side was not so big but interesting. It is good for family visiting.

The Highlight of My Trip. We had been on a Hop on Hop Off tour when we came across the area around the Tower. Wow it is so beautiful.
