long waiting in a long long line. Beautiful tower, lots of history, but also a very inefficient cashier. But if the cashier was more efficient, then the tower would be even more crowded than it already is. Prepare for long waiting in a long line....

fun to go to the top!. If you buy your ticket ahead of time - I got mine at the Jeranamos Monastery - you can get in a short line to go in. The steps to the top are very small, but the system they use for going up and down is really cool! Great views.

Go and see if in Belem and time to spare. Can get combined ticket with Jeronimo Monastery.
It's OK if you have time and can walk along the sea front but not worth a special trip

Where Architecture and Photography mix nicely. An excellent opportunity for great photos, and scenic view of the Tagus River joining the Atlantic. a tourist trap however...bus loads. Get the combo ticket for 12 euro if going to the monastery as well..
Sightseeing in Lisbon - Torre de Belem. This is a worthwhile historical monument in Lisbon in the Belem area. Combine it with a visit to Jerominos Monastery.

Photogenic but rather sterile!. The title says it all. The tower is exceptionally photogenic and I wouldn't miss having seen it but it's extremely crowded ... so much so in fact that I couldn't even be bothered waiting in line so long to see what the waterfront look liked from the top of the tower. Take your photo of the tower, enjoy a walk along the waterfront and then look for a restaurant to sit down and relax with some seafood and a glass of wine.

Don't miss this if you are neaby, after visiting Jeronimos palace. Don't miss this if you are neaby, after visiting Jeronimos palace. A short 20min walk. You can get a combined ticket to climb the torre. Give yourself enough time for both, at least 3 hours.

Good photo oportunity. The tower is set on the seaside and offers excellent photo opportunity, most visitors combine this with the Jeronimos Monastery, but is quite a walk from one to another, allow about 30 min for a slow relaxing walk. There are also a few photogenic places along the shore between the two.
Must see. Being in Lisabon and don't see this what a shame. Perfect in any ocasion, must try cookies from Pasticcerie de Belem.
glad we queued . they only allow 149 up the tower so there was a queue but it turns around quite and it's worth it the stairs are quite steep and narrow so be warned

Beautiful building from the outside.. Really worth a look from the outside. Nice restaurant nearby to chill out if very hot.We did not go inside as the restaurant was calling, but I understand the views from up top are great.If going here please note that the train station is nearly half a mile away so there may be a better option. We were using the red open air jump on / off buses.
Great view. Very well organized - there was a queue but moving fast enough. Worth climbing 93 spiral steps. Perfect view from the top floor.

Interesting . It is interesting to see how the Portuguese people relate their history and culture to their direct and intimate relationship with the sea, and this tower is a manifest of that relationship.

just outside Lisbon. if you want to take a short break from down-town Lisbon, take a short ride to the west and visit Torre de Belem. even if only just for a walk and to check it's location and architecture. this whole area is good for an excursion as you can also visit centro cultural, Jeronimo Monastery of wait in a long line for a taste of real " pastel de nata".

Interesting. Unless with a tour guide or the use of a tour book, there are things to see, but little to read on the history. I would suggest a tour guide as they can provide more details or interesting stories.

Amazing history !. We visited the Belem Towe as part of our itinerary with Sintra Magik Tours.What an impressive monument along the shores of the Tagus River.The history that envelopes this area is intoxicating. A must see monument while visiting Lisbon.

Very nice Outing site. The Tower is hosted by the Tajo river, is an amazing place to relax and walk across the site. As a Historical site represents to your imagination a Castle or a Ship, is up to you!! Can visit inside, the line takes some minutes, many visitors as the Summer time is starting to warm up! The park is easy and safe to go around, bars and cafe's are available. The Torre depicts a piece of Portugal although is was erected on behalf of Saint I cannot recall. It's full of designs to watch.Gilberto- PR

Another good example of Manueline architecture. If you purchase a ticket at the nearby St Jerome monastery you can avoid the queue to get into this tower which is a worthwhile place to visit. As there are so few examples of Manueline architecture left due to buildings being destroyed in the 1755 earthquake in Lisbon this is a 'must'. We did have to queue to get up to the top section of the tower as only 120 people are allowed there at any one time. It is a fabulous structure and you get brilliant views over the water from here.
Fabulous fortification. We did not go inside having been warned it's not worth it....loved the setting anyway. We hopped off a red bus....good way to see the sights if you're limited for time
Vasco Da Gama. The monument is iconic and a landmark for Lisbon. The story around it is equally mesmerising about how Lisbon defended it's ports.

Worth a visit.. Lots of history in this well preserved Tower. Nice views of river and surrounds. A little crowded, particularly climbing the one way spiral stairs to the top. Could be better organised. Recommend buying combined ticket to Jeronimos Monastery.

Picturesque Castle on the Water. My daughter and I walked from the train stop in Belem. It was a beautiful walk along the coast, passing some restaurants and small boat harbors.Torre de Belem is small, but still a marvel, built in the water. Enjoyed it very much.

An impressive tower. The Belem tor was very easy to get to from Lisbon by train. The tor is within zone 1 and the ticket was only 5 euros return. The tor was very impressive and l would recommend visiting here.

Over-rated. Arrived at the tower of Belem using the 15 tram from the main square in Lisbon. The tower is surrounded by a nice park and greenery.The tower itself was smaller than expected and a little dull, after a thorough look at the outside we decided not to go in and headed for the monastery instead.
Interesting momument. Big tourist attraction but well worth visiting. Set at the entrance to the river and with good views. Easy to get to from central Lisbon.

Skip if you have limited time. There was a big queue when we went and to go up to the top you wait another 20 mins for the people up there to cime down. The stairs are very narrow and there is no resting as you are followed by a lot of people. Once you are on the top there is a nice view but i would say if you havent got time you can skip this and just take photos from outside

Belem via train. Despite what two tourist information staff told us you can get their by train it is very easy to get the train from Cais de sodre. The Tower is very impressive and so worth seeing in Lisbon

Where is the rhino? :) . Try to spot the rhino on the edge of one of the towers facing the waterside.The story of the rhino comes from a man (forgot his name), who wanted to know who was stronger an elephant or a rhino. He let a rhino and elephant fight one another. The rhino won. He decided to give the rhino as a gift to the pope and travelled by ship. During the long seatrip the rhino died, but he didn't backdown on the gift idea. The rhino was mummified and presented to the pope.I didn't visit inside the tower. Only enjoyed the sea, the story and the beautiful sea.
Beautiful. A lovely area of Lisbon near Belem, has a beautiful view of the bridge. Need to take the tram from the city center, otherwise it's an ambitious 90 min walk.

OK but you've seen so many photos if it beforehand, it doesn't make the impact it deserves.. Well worth visiting, but so iconic, that you feel you've seen it before. Do view it from all sides ( bar the river!!!) outside more impressive, not sure of the value of going in!

Overcrowded. The tower is impressive (from the outside)don't bother going inside, because you might need a long queu (and waiting time) to go up, which offers you not much more than the views you have already around

Lovely to see. This is an iconic view in Lisbon, and the breeze is pleasant on a hot day. We admired the architecture, but did not wait in the very long line. Entrance is free with the Lisboa Card, but the Card no longer gives you front-of-the-line entry. Other attractions are a short walk away.

Beautuful. We spend the whole day sightseeing in Belem and this was one of our stops. We didn't go inside. Instead we admired the building from the outside, took photos and pick seashells at the shore right in front of Torre the Belem. The building itself is beautiful as well as the whole surrounding area.

Stunning Attraction. We had just visited the nearby monastery and walked to see this other major attraction in this area.We had obviously only seen pictures of this famous landmark before and were blown away by how stunning it was. Great place to take some lovely photos as well.We were advised just to look from the outside and not bother paying to go in ( queues can be extensive too ) as inside isn't supposed to that good.
Stunning monument. Don't miss this - it is quite stunning and appears to float as you look at it. We really enjoyed just looking!

Very nice. Wonderful, it is a place to see when you just finished the Monastery (it is just near, some tens meters). But think about taking the Lisboa card at AskMeLisboa (tourist office) which costs just a little less than 20€ and allow you to access freely to several monuments like Belem tower, the monastery, the Santa Justa elevator in the city and so on. Come to the monastery by tramway it is easier and more comfortable and then walk to the tower.
Very nice . Very nice .up you can see a good view.We climb up ,it take time.the same sters are for up and down .

A must to see in Lisbon from the outside!. Gave this well know tower and one of THE symbols of Lisbon offcourse a visit. The line wasn't too long to get in and also had a bit of luck with getting on top. Views are nice but not the best you can find in Lisbon if I am honest.The building itself from the outside hower is very nice to see at a nice setting just in the river.
Nice view. A very nice place to see, take pictures and history from Portugal, very close to other attractions. Good to see about history, nice place, very close to Pastel de Belem.
Lisbon's Other Castle. Reminiscent of English forts and moorish strongholds. A fine example of a well-kept guardian of Portugal's waterways.

Great views. We bought our tickets for Torre De Belem at the same time that we bought our tickets for Jernimos Monestary. We saw the monestary first and walked over to the Torre De Belem along the water. It was a very nice walk with beautiful views of the water. When you get in line for the Torre De Belem, there are 2 lines. The line on the left is to purchase tickets, and the line on the right is for people who have already purchased their tickets. This is not clearly displayed and we ended up standing in line longer than we needed to. Either way, the views are great. Once inside there is a small spiral staircase that will take you to the top. They only allow a certain number of people up at a time so you may have to wait in line again. The views are great and it is a great location to get panoramic views of the city and water.

You get the best of it from the outside.. Sure, you get inside because the ticket allows you to enter the Jeronimous complex as well, and don't need queueing twice. But apart from that, the beauty of this piece of manuelino architecture is best admired from outside.
Magestic. Beautiful...historical...with a great view of the area from the top. Transfers you back in time. Interesting to see the small area where prisoners was kept.
Must see in Lisbon . Amazing place with amazing architecture. I was there during night and it's just stunning. I think it's a must see place in Lisbon.

Iconic Lisbon Monument. Visited Lisbon's most iconic Belem Tower, also an UNESCO Heritage Site. Located by the Lisbon's coastline. Many tourists prefer to find a good spot for a photograph. Entering it is unnecessary, cause all iconic spots are located along the promenade.Along the promenade you can also see the old fashioned warplanes. Also see the longest suspension bridge "Ponte 5 de Abril Suspension Bridge".Really spectacular! Must see when visit Lisbon.
Boat tour visit. Not very well lit attraction, a nice memorial either way. Really enjoyed the renessaince feeling to it.

Beautiful spot, a must see. A beautiful spot, an absolute must see in Lisbon. I didn't go inside because of a long line on a hot day but the outside is stunning and definitely worth a visit. Afterwards go and have some delicious Pasteis de Belem!

Visit this Lisbon icon. The Torre de Belem is an iconic Lisbon landmark and is well worth a visit, despite being outside the centre of the city. Easily reached by bus train, tram or tuktuk, Belem is a very cool area with lots of restaurants and interesting footpaths and cycle ways. You can combine visiting the tower with other local landmarks such as Jeronimo's Monastery

Perfect place for a picture. Beautiful architecture especially the outside. Inside is a bit disappointing to climb up the stairs there is a waiting line as the number of people on the upper floor is limited for safety reasons.
Historical. The building has historical significance and is worth the visit. Entry to the tower is number limited so be prepared for a long wait.

Great views. An amazing structure with some very interesting things to see inside, but also breathtaking views of the area. Just absolutely amazing. On the day we visited it was a rainy and blustery day, but even so it was a really enjoyable outing, thanks to this beautiful tower.

Beautiful tower. There was a fun run on in the morning so on our tour couldn't see the tower until early evening.It was smaller than I thought and still had a huge historical significance. Lovely to walk around and admire the intricate features.

Very historic structure dating back many centuries.. This one of the most historic structures in Lisbon and a must see. While in the neighborhood walk to nearby Cathedral and Monument to the Discoverers.

Nice views. We took combined ticket of the monastery and Belam tower, which comes out to be cheaper. Also helps you avoid the ticket queue in Belam tower and you can directly enter the tower. Beautiful view. You can see lots of sail boats which enhances the beauty. For me the sailboats & the beautiful sea in front was the highlight..
Beautiful Architecture and history. Despite the line to get in and then another line once you are inside, we really enjoyed the tour and the views from the top are beautiful. Totally worth it.

Iconic Monument. This former defensive tower is an iconic remnant of the Manueline style of architecture that shows Portugal's combination of sea power and royal power. It is worth entering to walk around the terraces and below ground spaces. The access to the upper levels is controlled by time and number of people. A given number of people are allowed up to the top level and then they all have to drift down before the next surge is allowed to ascend. This means a wait of about 20 - 30 minutes for each surge, and the views were not that special, not worth waiting for.

Emblematic Tower. The Belem Tower is one of the most emblematic buildings in Portugal, and you will see its image all over the country in magnets, t-shirts and other souvenirs. The tower itself is not terribly exciting, but worth the visit if you are already seeing the monastery as you can get a nice discount when buying tickets for both. Don't be surprised if you lose your breath walking up the spiral staircase to the top of the tower. The riverside walk from the monastery to the tower is also nice if the weather allows.

Great monument . This great and historic monument was build few centuries ago to protect the entrance of the river.Still in very good condition. Situated near other historic monument "Padrão dos descobrimentos ".The visit cost 6 euro.I recommend a visit.

Good enogh to see from outside . Not really worth to pay to inside... this is rather parts of places to see when you walk along coast . But It's beautiful tower , worth to spend some time if you go this area but not destination

Very Pretty. This tower is beautiful and also a wonderful place to sit by the water. It wasn't open when I visited as it was 1st May (a national holiday- lots of things were closed!), which was a shame. A nice visit all the same.

Wonderfull historical site. Enjoyed very much, this monument is one that we see when we are landing. We walked around and then we found this pastry shop that sell natas (custards) de Belem, the best that I have ever had.

Did I miss something?. Long queue to get in, long and slow queue to climb the tower, long queue to come back down the tower. All this for a tower that except for a few small cannons and a view that is average at best. The best views are actually on the ground with the tower in the foreground - and this view is free. Much better views in the high points in and around the city proper.

Belem riverfront. All located within seeing distance of each other the Belem Tower, the Monument to the Explorers and the Jeronimis Monastery and its Cathedral are all remnants of those day when Portuguese men went down to the sea in small ships and made our world larger rounding Africa, discovering the Canary Islands, Brazil and eventually circumnavigating the globe. Vasco of de Gama is entombed in the church. The tower date from a time when the harbor and town needed defending. Interesting but little explanation at the sites.
Simply stunning. The Torres to Belem is Definitely a stop for anyone visiting Portugal-also definitely a tourist attraction. Should you go with or without a tour? YES. It is absolutely stunning.

Touristic visit . Quick visit to this cool tower in Belem neighborhood. It is pretty interesting if you are in the area check it out. However if you are not..you are not missing a whole bunch. I found it pretty interesting but a bit expensive. Again if you are in the area why not.
Good place. It's a good place to must visit being in lisbon. Thought I did not entered inside due to the long waiting queue.
Beautiful Tower of Belem. This is a very beautiful spot just a short walk from the Discoveror's Monument in Lisbon. You can go all the way to the top if you wish.
Wine with a view. lovely place to walk along the river . Try local wine from Wine with a View and you get to keep the glass .

Worth going for. Its a beautiful tower. Nothing much to see but walls but being on the same tower that yields history is worth going for and it only cost 6.00€ to get in. You can take panoramic pics from inside or on the roof top.

Lovely & romantic place to visit. We visited around lunch time & there was a queue to go up to the top. They let people up in batches of about 120 then wait for all 120 to come down as there is only one set of stairs. When coming down we were allowed into the Kings chamber & on to the balcony - do look out for the entrance as you negotiate the circular staircase - it isn't advertised or labelled at all!

Reminiscing Portuguese Era. Portuguese people in my mind has been famous with its occupation in many countries. Here I can feel the history on how they start to sail the seas and find some nations. Love the architecture and the environment too
Too busy. Every bakery in the area sells pasties that are equally as good without having to stand in line. Tourist trap. They were tasty though!
Beautiful. I do not enter to the tower, but is beautiful from the outside. You must visit it when you go to Lisbon.

Emblematic symbol. Perhaps the most utilised monument in the covers of tourist brochures about Lisbon, the emblematic Torre de Belem from the Navigators era and Henry who started it all for this once great nation. A must see in combination with the Jeronimos monastery and the Padrão.

Nice to visit if its your first time. Since its been our first visit to Lisbao, we were guided to visit Belem. We have taken E15 tram to reach there. I must say its good to visit that place once ..you will find many monuments and ships across coastal line reflecting Portuguese history and culture to an extent. We have gone to the top of Padrao Dos Descobrimentos..from there we could see entire colorful Lisbao city.. Later have seen Torre De Belem and Jeronimos Monastery from outside to save time. The building architectures are great!
Day in Lisbon . I didn't go inside but I really enjoyed from the outside! Great spot to take pictures and just hang outside. Great for all ages.

Torre de Belem. Re-visited it after 20 years. We were able to enter it back then, but nowadays it seems like you can only view it from the outside. Still a lovely fort with lots of history and a great spot for photo taking. Close by is a replica of an old seaplane
Great for an afternoon . Had agreat time spending the afternoon looking at the architecture. Plenty of places for a snack or sit down lunch.

Turist attraction but not more.... You need to see it as one of the places in Lisbon recommended to see. Combine it with other Belem attractions to see as it is far way from the center. There is a long waiting queue to the entrance and another one to go to the top of the tower. Slightly empty interior... do not expect too much from this visit otherwise you will be disappointed.

Very nice. You can go there by train or bike (yes, it s not too far). Very nice to sit there under the sun just looking at this beautiful tower in the middle of the water. Read some history about it before going, helps to enjoy !

One of the most beautiful districts in Lissabon. In my opinion Belem is one of the most beautiful districts in Lissabon. The houses are in good condition, there are beautiful monuments and even the embassies have their registered office there on the hills.

A bit out of the way but worth seeing. This was on every recommended list so we had to see it. It's an interesting building with many levels and good views of the river. The stairs to get up to the different floors are very narrow and winding and there are red and green lights to tell you when you can go up or down. After the tower we took a medium length walk to the Jeronimos Monastery, since they are both a way off from central Lisbon.
Well worth a visit. Belem is a lovely area to the West of Lisbon and easily accessed by Tram, The Tower is the pinnacle of the area.

Place to see . When you go to Lisboa you need to see the tower but don't expect anything special. It is a long way from the centre. Many way to go. The faster way and the less busy is by train for 6€ to go and come back for 2 people.
It's a Tower. There's nothing wrong with the tower, or seeing it. But it was nothing special. Maybe better in mid-day sun instead of cloudy day.

Expected more. Had high expectations as this is a UNESCO site but somehow it did not meet them. It is a pretty building but nothing special. Did not go in so cannot comment. It is worth seeing as it is close to the Jeronimos monastery, which I loved, but other than that it would not be worth it to go and see it on its own in my view.

BELEM TOWER. We were unfortunate, for although it was a wonderful day, it was Corpus Christie w/e and the crowds were thick. We didn't have time therefore to go inside but it was still worthwhile going there just to admire such a beautiful building.

Stand and appreciate the history this tower has witnessed. One of the cities most recognisable historical monuments, the Belém Tower sits at the side of the River Tagus, though originally sited in the middle of the river.Built between 1515-1521 a symbol of Portugal's Age of Discovery during the 16th century as a fortress to guard the entrance to Lisbon’s harbour, and the starting place for all voyages of discovery. Its ornate façade is adorned with fanciful maritime motifs - all carved out of stone. This area was packed with tourists, we actually fancied seeing inside the tower, but due to long queues at 10.30am we decided against it. There is a small fee, but only 120 people are allowed inside the tower at any one time, standing outside is still brilliant. Apparently if you climb steep spiral staircase to the top-floor tower terrace, you will rewarded with a fine panorama of the waterfront and the river. There is a great park opposite, shops, places to eat and lots of taxis

Maybe a bit too much queuing and then another queue inside. There is no doubt this is one of the main tourist attractions for Lisbon. But so far as queuing is concerned it can be somewhat frustrating. Firstly, everyone who has purchased a double entry ticket over at the Monastery has a speedy entrance lane which leaves all the other punters - like me, waiting ever longer at what feel like a non moving queue. Secondly only when you get inside do you get to find out that this first queue only gives you access to the first open level of terrace and one large ground floor room and a shrunken cellar - if you read the history you will have learned that a previous (baddie) owner used to keep his prisoners in the flooded cellars, hence the floors have been raised (concreted up to a non-flood level) this means a short visit to couple of rooms which you have to stoop to enter to see - basically nothing!! Thirdly, to get to the top of the tower there is yet another long queue, by this time frustration had taken over and I didn't bother with queuing again, even though it might be the first and last time I come to Lisbon - and I don't mean that in a negative way. I thoroughly enjoyed the whole 7 days, but there are other city breaks I am keen to experience, indeed, Lisbon has given me the confidence to believe that we can do more of these, it was brilliant.

Iconic landmark, great outing, disappointing documentation on site. This is one of Lisbon's most iconic landmarks, and a rare survivor or the 1755 earthquake. It once stood well out into the harbor, but is now on the north shore of the Tagus, thanks to the aftermath of the earthquake and tsunami. While well preserved, and surrounded with a lovely park, the information concerning the tower's history on site is sketchy and could be far better.

Do climb up the tower to enjoy the beauty of this old structure. You need to stand in 2 queues before you can reach on top of this tower. First one is for ticket into tower and later another one for going on top as authority allow only limited people on top.you will have to climb nearly 95 narrow and steep steps to reach on top. Better go there early morning or during lunch time to avoid long queues.

WONDERFUL VIEW. Waiting in line to tour this tower, and it was well worth it!The views from up top were exquisite! All of Lisbon was visible and a great vehicle to get your bearings.And the best part was the view of the bridge which is quite similar to the Golden Gate.We thought we had been transported back to San Francisco.
4-day city trip with all the best sights . Nice trip to the tower. OK views but you can get better from closer to the city centre. Not a great deal of information about the tower really.

Belem is easy to find. Great place to visit. If you arrive in Lisbon by boat see it as you arrive.trains, Trams and buses go there also from the centre. Great to walk around and see this historic monument

Great history that can be appreciated from outside. If the entrance line is long, I do not think it is worth waiting for -- you can still understand it from the riverbank. If you do visit, there are multiple combination tickets you may find useful; I bought the ticket that included Jeronimos Monastery. It is included in the Lisbon Card, but you will still have to stand in line.....no cutsies!! The lines get long because the tower is small (and old!) and can only hold a certain number of visitors. They have to clear out a certain number before the next group is admitted, and the traffic flow is very confusing because the space is so small. I did not enjoy being herded like confused cattle.Its waterfront location meant Belem was vulnerable to sea attacks, so the area was fortified to serve the city’s defense system. A large tower, Torre de Belem, was built in the Tagus River. Today, it is a UNESCO World Heritage site. The tower was a fortress in the middle of the Tagus River at the time of its construction in the early 1500s, but the river has since receded, and today it lies barely offshore. It is nice to think about it probably seemed formidable centuries ago....but you do not need to go inside for that.I have a review of my day in Belem on my blog if you want to read more......link in my TripAdvisor profile.

Lovely tower, nice park in front to chill . I came here after visiting the Jeronimos Monastery. It's about a 20 minute walk. I bought a combined ticket at the monastery for entrance to the tower and it was €12 for both. If you want to visit just the tower is is €6. If you already have a ticket you can skip the queue on the left and go straight in from the right. There is a timed entrance to the top of the tower and as such the queues can get rather long once even inside the tower. I most enjoyed the view of the tower from the outside so it's not really necessary to go inside because the view from the tower isn't really that impressive. Giving four stars because it's a very beautiful tower even though is is quite boring once inside.
super natural view. last month i was here with my friends, a very special historical place that attract me always, i will visit again,,,
A visit only for an photo from outside. You dont need to go inside. A lot of peaple stend outside an sit at the river and make a lot of pictures. The building is nice to see. It stand in the sea.

Tremendous Tower. Belem Tower was built in 1515 to 1521 and was originally in the middle of the River Tagus as a fortress. It was stuffed full of arms to protect the city. Some excellent stone carvings in the Manueline style of architecture this is a pleasure to visit. Opening times 10am to 6.30pm and entrance fee is 6€ and basic English guide is 1€. This is self walk around. Narrow spiral staircase to the top which is a spacious fortified platform giving some good veiws. Public toilets near by. Loads of public parking near by however gets extremely busy after 11.30am especially at weekends. Can be reached by metro to Casa do Sodre station and then catch the overground train to Belem and costs approximately 4€ for a single journey.

Iconic landmark of Lisbon. This tower is often the symbol of Lisbon. Not essential to go inside. Up the tower is redistricted to 120 people, and the next group are only allowed in when previous group have all left.Interesting inside - but if short of time view from outside
Iconic building. Positioned as it is facing out to the Tagus river and close to the city it is a great digital photo must.

An interesting bit of history. I suppose the Torre counts as one of the 'must do' attractions in Lisbon. However, there's no guidance of any sort (apart from one computer screen with a slideshow) to explain why this tower is so important. Also worth noting is that it's 93 steps in a small spiral staircase to reach the top - not for the weak of heart or unfit.Once at the top, the views are nice - though when we were there, we didn't get that long at the top before we were being chivvied back down the stairs to enable the next group to come up.

Great view from the top.. We visited just before 17:00 (last entrance) and did't have to queue because we had a combination ticket with the Jerónimos Monastery. Not really much to see except for the view from the top. This is reached by 93 steps in a narrow spiral staircase. They manage (limit) the number of people going up so you may have to wait.

Unique fantastic tourist attraction. Ancient fort (Bellem Tower) . You'll can take a nice pic with the Lovely seagull. Beautiful place to take iconic photo selfie at sunset. Fairprice souvenir shops just nearby.

Beautiful Views. We felt our trip to Lisbon would not be complete without a stop at Torre de Belem. The setting is beautiful: by the water and with views of the 25 de Abril Bridge and Cristo Rei Statue - great for photographing! It is more than just a box to be ticked and truly recommended.
Nice landmark to compliment your visit to Belem. Iconic and a beautiful setting at the mouth of the Taugus River flowing into the Atlantic Ocean. Worth the historical visit.
Interesting Place. I chose not to bother paying the entrance fee and really enjoyed just walking around the outside. Great photo opportunities to be found here and outstanding architecture.
Tourist Attraction. A nice place to visit right by the Rio Tejo. Historical monument a great place to get a drink and just sit and people watch.
Fun. The tower is gorgeous and it gives you a pretty nice view of Lisbon. There isn't much to see inside the tower, it is a little bit small. The tickets are only 6€ I believe so it's not expensive!
Too touristic. Nice place to visit , but it was too touristic. You cannot catch the atmosphere of the city. Full of tourist buses

Amazing architecture surrounded by a small amour of the sea.. We did not go inside the castle as there were far too many queuing in May, makes you wonder how it is in the July/August holiday season. Interesting shape and architecture.

Enjoy it from the outside. Had prepaid tickets purchased as part of entry to the San Jeronimo Monastery so avoided the queue on the wooden bridge in the sun. Walked around the inside in a matter of minutes as not much there. Up to the main open area through a log jam of people. Nice enough view but nothing special.The joined a long queue to the top of the tower. Maybe 30 minutes in total, as the let 120 up at a single time (every though they have turnstiles that could ensure no more than 120 people at any time). You then wait for that 120 to fully climb then return. Bizarre people management.Once you get to the top, you are really not that high, and you realise the only thing in the immediate area worth viewing is the tower itself!Then you have to wait for the rest of the 120 to finish ascending before you can go back down...If you really want to visit, make sure you have the prepaid ticket and stop at the first level. Don't bother with the tower.Much easier to enjoy from the outside...
Architectural jewel - The Tower of Belem. The Torre de Belém was originally completely surrounded by water but today the tower is easily accessible from the riverbank.

Lovely architecture . After reading the reviews advising not to bother paying the €6 to go inside, we just took some photos from the outside whilst marvelling at the architecture. We then strolled down the quayside and paid €4 to ride to the top of Padrão dos Descobrimentos monument, with terrific views of the suspension bridge, Mosteiro dos Jerónimos and the Belém tower.
Lovely Historic Monument. Great monument .the Tower was built as a tribute..Very impressive architecture on the banks of the river
Do not go when the sea is rough!!. Do not miss this small tower. You'lll feel lke in ancient times. But do not go when the sea is rough if you do not want to get wet

Ok, but I'd pick the Monument to the Discoveries if you only do one.. We had a Lisboa Card, so we did the Belém Tower and the Monument to the Discoveries. The Monument to the Discoveries had a pretty short line, and an elevator that takes you almost to the top. We had to wait in line for about 30-minutes at the Belém Tower, and then found out we had to wait in another fairly long line to actually climb the tower itself. I believe they only allow 200 people in the tower at a time, so until someone leaves, no one else can go in. We didn't have the time to wait again, so we looked around the lower level and left.If you have a Lisboa Card, be aware that it does not allow you to skip the line at the tower. Their signs clearly state that you have to wait in the main ticket line with everyone else. If you don't have the card, you can buy a combo-ticket for the tower and the Jerónimos Monastery, which will let you skip the line at whichever attraction you visit last. If you have a Lisboa Card, it does allow you to skip the line at the monastery, so we were able to walk right in when we went there.The Belém Tower is interesting, but if you only have the time or money for one, I'd recommend the Monument to the Discoveries. Either way, it's at least worth walking over to see the outside of the Belém Tower.

Ahoy. Go there on a beautiful day and you won't be alone. The favorite trip of all the tourist. Grab a tram or train and pay a visit to the other beautiful spots in this area as well. Keep in mind to take all day to walk around on a sunny day, because it can be crowded.

Beautiful ornate tower.. A must-see in Belém. Go to Mosteiro dos Jeronimos first where the line is short and buy the tickets for both attractions there. Then go have the pastel de Belém. Then burn the calories by walking to the Tower. There is an underpass that takes you to the other side under the train tracks. Not even ten minutes.

Impressive piece of Architecture!. The Torre de Belem is on the banks of the River - it was built as a fortress to defend the mouth of the river. - unfortunately it wasn't open to see inside but worth a visit with the many other tourist attractions in belemYou can get to Belem by train from Lisbon, 10 minutes and less than 2 euros!!

Nice Tower...Won't miss much if you skip it.. One set of narrow steep steps lead you and lots of other tourists up and down the tower. I wouldn't recommend it to friends as a must-do activity while in Lisbon. Simply snap some photos from the outside & walk over to Jeronimo's Monastery where there's more to see and offers way more space to accommodate the amount of people that visit these sites which is a lot!

Beautiful. No need to go in necessarily (the staff were fairly rude) , just go by and have a look! It's beautiful. Neat history too, as it used to be on an island until the earthquake in 1755 at which point the water patterns changed.

Amazing architecture. To see this tower and knowing it was built in a place that was in the middle of the river is an awe-inspiring sight. It's quite an impressive monument to the power and perseverance of the human spirit.

was ok. It's an Iconic place. But for me it was just ok. I'm glad I saw it but wouldn't return. there were a lot of gypsies selling things. They were aggressive. DO NOT GIVE EYE CONTACT and keep walking

Historic beauty. A beautiful stone castle that is definitel worth a visit. The lines moved rather quickly but there is a definite advantage to having advance purchase tickets. Very long lines to go up to the top of the tower.
Must see. We personally loved Belem tower and would definitely recommend paying to go inside and queueing to get to the top of the tower.

Interesting building in the sea!. If you're visiting the Monastery it's well worth the walk along the river front. Check the days and times of opening to make sure that when you arrive you can actually get in!

Little castle. Lovely afternoon in Belém with family, try pasteis de Nata they are unic. The gardens are clean , the museums are amazing and the locals are very hospitality. Negative feedback is they have a Mcdonald s in the place that have a lovely city
Beautifl!. Amazing history and architecture - definitely worth the visit. Make sure you go inside to check out the beautiful gallery.

Interesting but not special. We spend about an hour and a half waiting to get in, then to get in the tower, then to get down and out. Totally not worth it, views are better on the top of the explorers' monument, Jeronimos monastery is far more interesting!
A Beautiful Building. A stunning old structure built out into the river. Very popular at the time we visited. Best photo opportunity is just before dusk.

Must visit. As mostly know, Torre de Belem is a must visit. I know a lot of people who dont go inside and I recommend it a lot. There is a lot to learn inside about Portuguese military. It is so cheap too!

I loved the torre de Belem. For some reason I was really attracted to this; for what it represented the history. I did queue up to view and was well worth it. You can see the canons and walk up the first set of stairs; where the view is really good with a nice breeze. The second set of stairs I queued up but then was advised it will take upto 30 mins. I walked around and then left.

Very beautiful attraction. Went to see Torre de Belem today. It's a very beautiful site and worth seeing. We did not go inside as the lineups were long and we had young children with us so didn't feel like making the effort. Nonetheless, it was great to see and I would recommend pairing it with a visit to the nearby monastery.

If you like to be a tourist with other tourist why not. So many tourist in this place. The monument are interesting, the centro cultural is nice but the whole place is sort of artificial. All is made to get the maximum number of tourist. If you suffer from Agoraphobia just avoid the place

Lisboa Belem. We went to Belem district by bus 728,visited Church first.No entrance fee.İf you want to go there by Tram 15E,it works after 10.00 AM.Don't forget to eat Nata sweet at Pastais de Belem.İt is delicious..After Nata,we walked to Torre do Belem and Padrao dos Descobrimentos.

One of the Lisbon's iconic places. Belem is one of the characteristic places of Lisbon. Thus; in every day, every hour touristic crowd available with small or big numbers. For entrance of tower, generally big quee occurs. But in my humble opinion, tower entrance has no important thing. Cause, if you enter to tower, the only thing you can do is take a photo against the ocean from different angles. You can do the same photo taking process even you don't enter the tower. If you are a student or has a tight budget, your money deserves better places for spend :) Every people ,who visit Lisboa, should see this area...

Nice tower but crowded. The tower is nice, but when the queue is long, I would think twice. Especiall the staiway up is a hazzle, if it is all crowded with tourists. If you would like to visit the tower, get tickets upfront to bypass the queue.
Buy tickets ahead!. Little beautiful place, great view. Buy tickets ahead so you don't have to stand in line because access is limited to max # of people at a time inside and in the lines get long

Beautyfull place to relax and explore. If you are the "Must-See-All" Tourist, just skip this - I had only a couple of hours, therefore, I decided to visit the Mosteiro dos Jerónimos and then to stoll along the shoreline up to the tower. Close to the military museum I took a glas of white wine on a terrace. After hard walking through Lisboa the days before this was a perfect chill-out trip. I grasped a little of Vasco da Gamas spirit looking towards the horizon of the ocean and picked up some Pastel de Belém on my way back to Lisboa. Do this during the week, at the weekend this place may get very crowded. Tipp: I took lunch close to the trainstation (Chais do sadré) before heading for Belem. There are some nice restaurants with terrace' in front of the river just beside the piers.
worth while. Impressive monument. The inside is less interesting. But the view of the outside is excellent. Easy to combine with visit to the monastery

Picture Perfect. We visited the Belém tower in April of this year. It is a beautiful historic place to visit and take pictures. They also have an ice cream shop and a restaurant to have lunch afterwards. Beware of the typical tourist scams that they try and pull at other popular European attractions. Keep your eye on your wallet and don't let your guard down. We were there in more of the down season, but in the heart of summer you can tell it would be a bit of a circus. Totally worth a visit though. It was the perfect stop before we headed out over the highway to Lagos.

Popular attraction. This is a popular attraction which can be perfectly combined with the other sightseeing places in Belem. Be prepared for long waiting cues to to take the stairs to the top of the castle, but it is worth waiting for. Beautiful views at the river and the large bridge

Worth the visit!. There was a long line of people waiting to get into the Belem Tower. As I did not have a lot of time, I did not take the official tour. Still, it is an historic landmark and a cool place to visit. If you're taking one the many hop-on hop-off bus tours, you can combine your visit to Belem Tower with several other historic sites. You can jump off at the Jerónimos Monastery, then walk through the Jardim da Praça do Império to the Discovery Monument. From there, it's a relatively short walk to the Belem Tower and Combat Museum. When finished, you can catch your bus from the Belem Tower stop. (Most buses stop there but be sure to double-check yours.)
Must see place. Unfortunetely it was closed in the day I was near. It is a must see place for us brazilians. Portuguese sailors started their journeys from there and the place is part of our History
Nice place to visit. Closed on Mondays, so only visited the outside. Worth the effort, and viewed it from both land and the river.

So many steps!. Definately worth a visit. Sooooo many stairs up to the tower but definately worth the effort.The other parts aren't really that interesting to be honest but it is interesting to think of the people who walked the floors before ourselves.Watch your head on the ceiling if you visit the jail though!

Fleeting visit. Stunning building, I was in Lisbon for work so I didn't get too long to stop and see this fine building. When I next come back soon to Lisbon I am coming back to see this in more detail. Stunning architecture :)

Not worth the effort, enjoy it from the outside.. Once you join the queue and get inside you think that that is it you are inside, wrong! You join another queue to get to the top of the tower which can take some time and to be quite frank it is not worth the time or effort, spend your time doing something more worthwhile. So if someone in your group suggests doing this make your excuses and say that you would rather not thank you very much.

Great River Front Square. Enjoyed walking around this great square famous for the Moorish Belem Tower a fortification on the banks of the Tagus river that once protected the city from pirates.The nearby monument to the discoveries featuring an astonishing 33 figures from the Portuguese Age of Exploration, on the prow of a ship.This was the setting off point for many of the Portuguese famous explorers.

Beautiful landmark, poor tourist attraction. The Torre de Belem is a really impressive landmark....from the outside. Unfortunately as a tourist attraction, it isn't worth the 6 Euros entry fee. Firstly, we had to queue nearly 20mins just to get in, although admittedly the line had shrunk by the time we left. The main outside area of the tower is quite nice to walk around and take a few photos. You can go downstairs and look at the prison cells but it isn't much to write home about. But then the main issue is the part where you can climb up a staircase to the top of the tower. There is only room for 120 people up the tower at any one time and because the staircase is so narrow, you can't have people walking up and down at the same time. So we waited 25 minutes downstairs until every single one of the 120 people in the group before had come down the stairs, before we could go up. And then when we went up, the view from the top turned out not to be really worth the wait. I totally understand why the management have to organise the system in this way, so I'm certainly not directing blame in their direction, but as a paying customer I'd say it's not worthwhile. Between arriving and leaving we were there for over an hour, and 45mins of that was spent queueing. My advice, take some photos from the outside, and then go and explore the rest of Belem.

Beautiful Tower situated on the Waterfront. Great place to visit but you do have to pay to reach the top of the tower. It also is located next to a big park where they organise festivals. Worth a visit.
Cool place. Very nice spot. Belem in general is a must-do part of the city. Torre de Belem provides a great view over the city. Lots of additional spot around.

A must see. Go early if it is high tourist season since there can be long lines. Be aware that nothing is well marked inside so ask or be adventurous! buy your tickets ahead if possible, there is a fast track line if you do

Nothing special, stupid organization. The tower would be a nice place (but still nothing special) when it was organized well. But first you have to wait for 30-60 min to get in and then you find out that this is only to get on the first platform. To enter the tower itself you have to wait again equally long - this is pointless.
Nice building, but overhyped and crawling with tourists. Nice from a distance but the area is swamped with tourists and their buses. We did not want to queue for half an hour so we did not go in.
Lovely area!. This famous tower at Belem is really very picturesque. Very crowded area with buses everywhere, and tourists also everywhere. Lovely picture opportunity!

My favorite . The Belèm is a specially monumental tower in Europe. I have seen most of things in Lisbon and I think it's the best that you can see. It's a little bit far from the center by walk, so if you can, choose the bus to reach it.
A great view on the Tagus. While in Belem, don't miss going up this beautiful tower, symbol of the Portuguese history. I love the architectural details. Look for the gargoyle in form of a rhinoceros.
Must See Ode to Vasco da Gama. This is a lovely UNESCO site, originally built to fight off seafaring warriors. It's ornamentation is an ode to Vasco da Gama. Definitely a worthwhile visit.

Awesome Visit to Belem. I am from New Orleans. My family and I traveled to Lisbon, Portugal for a visit. We decided to visit Belem for a day. We took a cab there but once in the square, we hopped on a Tuk Tuk for the tour of Belem. Please wear comfortable shoes and bring a light jacket. It is a little chilly in March. A must stop is Pasteis de Belem. Start your day off with great coffee and danish. After lunch, many places to eat, try Ginja D'Obidos. This is a sour cherry liqueur you must experience in Belem. Oh, by the way, take a couple of bottles back home with you to remember your visit. It was a great day in Belem.

You must stop here for a photo - its required of all tourists. It will be crowded, there will be hawkers and it will be impossible to get a photo without other people in it. But a stop at this statue is a must.
Beautyfull Tower. This tower is a very beautyfull building. On rainy and windy days the visit is not so nice. The entry price of 12 € / person is also expensive for this little building.

Tower Visit. The tower is free, but you still must line up & receive a "receipt". You then can easily access the first & second level. At the second level you will be required to wait (about 20 min) in a queue, until all the people on the top level have come down before you are allowed up. They only allow 120 persons up at a time. When you start climbing that tight spiral staircase & then see the limited space on top , it will make sense why they have this rule. We found it to be a worthwhile visit.

Beautiful Historical Site. It's not far from City Center. You can take a train there or get a taxi (within 10 min ride and < 10 euros). Great view around it and next to the Monument and the J. Monastry.

An icon of Lisbon !. We stopped there on our City Sightseeing HOHO Bus tour and walked tower the Torre . Someone coming out of the Tower told us that the entrance ticket was too expensive for a 20 minutes visit ! So we took pictures , walked around the area , looked at other sites and took the next bus . Still it was an interesting stop !

Long waits and lines. Try to go in May that way you get the beautifulPurple leaved trees. We went in August and the lines were terrible to get in. Like 3 hours. Worth going for the views. Good for picture taking. Once you get to the top of the tower it's heavenly and breathtaking as you get a view of the bridge. Make sure you get a telescopic camera to get the far distance shots.

Good attraction . The tower was OK with several photo opportunities but the long line to the top was not quite worth it since there's nothing much to see. Better if you visit on first Sunday of the month when entrance is free

Nice for those pictures. A very ancient piece of history and nice to photograph looking out over the river, admire it but you are not likely to spent much time. There are other attractions in this area. We got the tram 15 from centre to stop after Belem.

A great day out. The Torre is wonderfully ornate, and in the same style at the Jeronimos Monastery. There is a maximum of 120 people allowed up the tower, with a traffic light system to ensure the narrow stairway does not get blocked. I visited on a very wet day, so overcrowding was not a problem, but you may need to be patient if the weather is better. The view from the top was great, and helped explain the reason and position of the tower.

Belem tower. Good but a bit disappointed by how small monastery, and tower were, for the price you pay, not long been to Italy (Rome) and was spoilt on how good it was there for sights to see for the price you pay,
A wonderful spot. So beautiful!!! A great spot near the river. I wouldn't bother catching the tram down, take a walk through the park or on the water front. Lovely!!!

Great place for an afternoon an sunset. There's a lot to see in Belem, like the tower, the bridge, the discoverers monument and the monastery. Just stroll along the pier and enjoy incredible views. You can watch the sunset from the tower. It's beautiful. End your visit on a sweet note by eating as much "pasteis" as you can manage. They are so delicious
Beautiful part of history. This tower is beautiful building and great part of history of Belem area. It is nice to walk along the boulevard and see boats float past.
good historical tower. easy access by the tram gets very busy in the mornings lots of street sellers trying to sell you their goods opens at 10 am

Belem Tower Visit. Well preserved and again another impressive historic monument that sits on the river Tagus. Again if you can get the Lisboa Travel Card, as this will give you free or discounted entry to most of the most well known sites to visit within Lisbon.Paul B.

Great views, interesting history. With the Lisboa card entry to the tower is free, on three levels, the views of the river and surrounding area are great. Be prepared to queue for the top tower once you are in. Definitely worth a visit, if only for the different views offered.

Beautiful. A stunning place. The queue was very long, but definitely worth a wait. The view was stunning. You just imagine the fleet of ships coming in and out in 15th century! Really enjoyable visit.

Beautiful, but busy and a bit pricey. The tower itself is beautiful and has a great location. It is very touristy there and we had to line up even in off season. It was €6 to get in which I found a bit much to just walk around for max 10 mins
All along the watchtower. A very beautifull monument of power that i suggest to visit as early in the morning as possible,because the tourists are so many all the other hours .....
Awesome history behind. If you visit the torre de Belém, you need to read the history as well, because it's not just a nice block of stones. If you're in Belém, you should definitely visit it.

Touristic must. Even though the tower is actually pretty small, it's a must when you're in Lisbon. It's situated right next to the water and attracts lots of tourists. Queues can be quite long. For a view on the city, there are better places, like Padrao dos Descobrimentos, which is on walking distance from this tower.

Beautiful tower but don't pay for the visit . It's a nice walk along Tage river from the Monastery to get there. The tower is beautiful but you don't need to get inside. Since the place is small, you must wait to access each part of the tower and the view is not worth the time spent.Also, owning the Lisboa tourist card won't prevent you from queuing up to buy a ticket.Only those who paid for the entrance at the monastery will have a facilitated access and will eventually realize that there are more queues inside !!!
Stop off from the tourist bus. Very interesting and historical tower built n the 16th century. Situated in alovely area by the river. Cafe and the Military museum and Explorers monument nearby.

Belem Visit is a must. Belem is a beautiful area with lots to see and it is a must to visit Pasteis de Belem famous for its nata custard tarts....they are the best but be prepared to queue even for a take-away. Fabulous sites in this area such as the Monastery of Jeronihmo with its fantastic architecture

A little tower ..... Torre de Belem is only a little tower. There are probably better views from other places across the city but it has the advantage of being in a beautiful spot by the water. If you've visited the monastery pop over and have a look.
Historic Tower. Interesting tower, not far out of Central Lisbon. Near to other attractions such as monument to the explorers..

Must go with a guide who will explain everything . Wonderful experience. Traveled with my adult daughter. We were brought here by a private tour guide who took us to the important places to see & learn about.
We would not have missed it.

Took our Breath Away. We hired scooters and ended up here at Belem totally worth it to see this in the evening -
Dont leave Lisbon without seeing this

Worth a visit when in Belem.. It is worth a visit and is interesting. The walk along the river is a must as it puts the whole experience in a better perspective. It's a good way to walk of the custard tarts.

Sadly a wet day to see this but a definite 'must see'. A lovely view normally but unfortunately it was et and windy when we visited!! It is worth getting a tram though from Lisbon and visiting this lovely place.

Way overrated Lisbon attraction.. This tower is isolated by four lanes of traffic and a railroad track so it is a bit hard to access. When we did finally arrive by foot, there was a long line to get in and buy our tickets. Once past the entryway, you are diverted to a circular space with nothing other than a ring of small canons and a tiny gift shop. To actually get up into the tower, there was another long wait, after which you climb about 30 stairs to an open air space with a ring of tiny guard houses. But if you want to go further up, there is yet another, much longer line. Apparently, there are limits on the number of people who can go up to each level. Much to the consternation of people standing in line, large tour groups get to jump the line. You never do get to go to the top of the tower. This is not a rainy day activity as all the waiting is done outdoors. We went on a blustery, rainy day in May in the middle of the week. I'd hate to think of what it was like on a clear day in June or on a weekend. Of all the tourist attractions of Lisbon, this one could be skipped without missing much.
The Highlight of Lisboa. We were so fortunate to visit this place at sunset.. wow what an experience. This is a must when you visit Lisboa
Nice to see. It is in the bay of Lisbonne. Nice to take pictures and relax a bit. There are shops to buy souvenirs in the area.
Well worth a visit. Considering its a relatively small tower, there's lots to see and different views from every aspect.
Great area to visit.. Highly recommend renting some bikes and cycling around the area.Great history and lots to learn. As the norm with Lisbon, close by and around are Street acts.

Bit overrated. We went on the multi-entry ticket and were glad we hadn't paid a separate entry as it is very expensive and only takes 15 minutes to look around. There really isn't a lot to see, especially not on a really rainy day where we got absolutely soaked. The attraction is also very badly organised with traffic lights to allow people to get up and down the only set of very steep and slippery stairs. The lights weren't enforced on the day we were there leading to a very nasty confrontation with a big Italian group who started shouting at us and my elderly mother for being in their way. No staff stepped in to help and it totally marred the visit. The rest of Belen (especially the pasteis de nata!) is way nicer and more relaxing!

Loved it!. Wonderful place to visit and learn so much regarding the defence of Lisbon throughout the centuries. Amazing views across the River Tagus and so much information on the history of this magnificent structure. Well worth a visit!

Stay outside for the best part of this attraction. We spent quite some time waiting in line to get in, then waiting again to climb the steep and narrow spiral staircase to the top. Definitely not worth the wait! There are good views but you can see these elsewhere in Lisbon. And don't bother going downstairs--we queued to see a pile of rubble and some empty rooms. The best part of this attraction is the way it looks from the outside. I promise.

Historic tower on the river front. No visit to Belem would be complete without visiting the Tower, which sits on the river front. Originally part of the defence system, the historic tower is complimented by a 1:50 model located outside, provided in 2005 by the Rotary Club of Lisbon North to enable partially sighted and disabled visitors to enjoy the Tower and which is very popular with children also. Visitors can see some of the interiors and enjoy views across the river.

Lovely building. Belem is a decent walk along the river front from Lisbon City centre but it is well worth it - take your time and stop off at a few bars and cafes. The Torre de Belem is very photogenic - not much inside but the views are worth the effort.
Good to see . It is a goog place to see I have not pay to enterance taking photo from outside is enough The que is endless in front of the gate
Absolutely amazing . Fantastic place :) absolutely amazing, mystical atmosphere, lovely view. The ideal place for everyone. Great time :)

Historic and interesting. Most Lisbon visitors will come here. It's very small and only takes a short time to visit. Requires climbing a lot of steps to get to the top - maybe skip it if you are not in good health. Two tips: When you buy your ticket at the Jeronimo monastery, you can buy a combo that also includes the Torre de Belem. Also, if you travel out here by train, note that the Belem train station is quite a distance from the Torre. I'd say it's at least a mile walk. From the monastery, it's about a 10 minute walk. There is also a tram stop that is much closer to the Torre, the first stop after the monastery if you're on one of the trams/buses that go beyond the monastery (many do not).

Nice, Unique Structure on Water's Edge. Not a large structure, but wonderful for the location, views and open air on the river. Get there early since it does not hold a lot, and going up and down the same stairwell can create lines of people waiting...But worth the vistas from the top. Belem is a little bit out of the city so make a day trip with other places such as the monastery.
Not a rainy day tour. Not really much to see. The highlight is the top of the tower and on this rainy day all we could see were clouds. I did not feel it was worth the time we spent

Beautiful tower, only saw it from a boat though. This is definitely a beautiful structure, but instead of joining the throngs of tourists heading there, we decided to hop on a Sightseeing boat and view this Landmark from the water.

Torre de Belém. Well, it's an old tower. Def better to look at from outside than doing the tourist trap thing...
Must have been some kind of defense back in the days.

Interesting. A very interesting monument. The grounds are interesting as well with other monuments to visit, like the WWII airplane. A few shops nearby. Unfortunately, the day I was there it was so rainy and windy I could not even get any pictures. I'd love to go back in nicer weather and spend more time.

Bought ticket but didn't get in. We bought a Combined Ticket for the torre and the Mosteiro dos Jerónimos at the Mosteiro. When we went to visit the torre, they just closed the door in front of us (it was around 16:00, so it should have been open). Nobody answered our knocking at the door - we didn't got in although we already paid for it!

Quick, but worth seeing. There may not be more to Torre de Belem other than the views, but the hop on/hop off buses will bring you here and it's worth the trip.The tight spiral stairs to the top mean you have to be prepared for a bit of exercise and to have any sense of claustrophobia challenged.It can get busy and queues can form outside, but ours at least moved quickly. Besides, you can treat yourself to a surprisingly decent and refreshing mojito from one of the nearby vendors while you wait.
Great photo op. Very picturesque place in Lisbon, worth a visit! Belem means Bethlehem. Lisbon has many beautiful, historic attractions to see, with a lot of variety.

Historic old building. We visited this attraction on Sunday morning when it was free. Inside, on the ground floor, are several small cannon. Below that is another room without anything in it. After climbing some steps, one comes out into another area. After that one can go up to the tower. This place was originally built as a fortress but was soon rendered obsolete for that mission so it was turned into a prison, then a customs post, followed by lighthouse, and is now a tourist attraction.

Full day program. Belem is worth spending the majority ox a day in. You'll get there in less than 15 minutes. First tip: Do NOT (really-really do not) use the overcrowded tram. You really do not want to waste your life on that! Instead, take the local train (departs three times on hour) that follows the river bank. Less people, less hassle! Second tip: Make sure to include The Seafarers' mark (close to train platform), the Belem tower (get there early to beat the crowds), the monestary (or, at least, go sea the church and Vasco da Gama's monumental grave), and have your coffee break at the pastery-shop. Even if the waiting line for a table seems long, do not despare: With 400 tables, you'll quickly get a seat. The cakes are gooood and small enough to not being disgustingly sweet. Third tip: consider not commuting at all - in stead, rent a bicycle: If following the lane on the river bank, it is flat and no hills at all.

Beautfful historic tower in a nice location close to Lisbon. If you want to see a piece of history that is very close to Lisbon city centre then this a great place to visit on the weekend. The area is beautiful and there is a nice walking path along the river which is popular with the locals for running and walking on the weekends. You can really make a great day out of this visit as Belem itself is a must for anyone visiting Lisbon. Either before or after the tower and a nice walk you can visit Pasteis de Belem which is an amazing patisserie in Belem and has some of the best Portuguese tarts, pastries and biscuits you will find in Lisbon. Its very famous and popular so be preparted for a wait; however, there are plenty of seats and if you head straight to the back around all the bends you might get lucky and get a seat straight away. Overall you can really make a great day with a visit to this tower and Belem.
Worth popping in if free. When you have the Lisbo Pass this is free, so worth popping in if you are close by at Mosteiro dos Jerónimos. Not worth the entrance fee otherwise.

Beautiful tower well preserved. This tower was build in the 16th century. It's really beautiful with a great view on the Tage. We didn't pay to go Inside because the comments said it was too long. It's about 7€ to visit It.
Spectacular exterior.. Worth the visit. Spectacular exterior and situation. Go early to avoid crowds. Equally good from the riverside.

Nice tower. The tower is nice but far away from the city center. Foresee thus enough time to go until there and to comeback.
It is on the track of the hop on hop off buses.
Stunning building beautiful views. his is a stunning building and well worth the visit, there are beautiful views to be had which tmakes the steep climb worthwhile

Pretty area but not worth the wait to get up to the top. The Belem Tower is in a pretty area and is a pretty tower but we had to wait 20 minutes to get into the tower to take the steps to the top and then wait 10 minutes to get down again. There isn't anything much inside to see. With so many other view points in Lisbon, I just go see the area and not pay to go to the top of the tower.

Well worth a visit here!. My husband and I came here by train from the city and a did a tour of all the points of interest. The botanical gardens, monastery, the watchtower, Torre de Belem. It's a nice walk all along the River Tagus with restaurants and little bars along the way and on the main Street. You can easily spend a good half day here especially if visiting the monastery (get there early) it gets very busy. Enjoy!!
Great outdoors. What an incredible defence building. Impressively ornate and preserved. Definitely worth checking out and walking around. Another beauty of the wonderful city of Lisbon.

Cute and interesting . I'd bought my ticket so decided to just pass the giant queue and head to the front...and eventually found a sign at the front saying entrance for prepaid tickets! The tower limits the number of people so try to avoid coach parties! Cute but I'm glad I didn't queue for ages as it was more sweet than amazing. But it was raining and cold so I may not have had the best impression
I liked it. I went there with my portuguese friends and teacher, I love there. It's natural beauty, I like old building. That's why I like there. You should go there and You need to see ^^

Beautiful Tower. I visited on 1st May with my wife and was disappointed to find out that, despite all museums being free to enter on the 1st Sunday of the month, today it was shut! Something about it being a holiday. I can't comment on inside but it is an impressive structure. Definitely worth a photo!

Great from the outside, no need to go in. The tower is a great sight from the outside and quite disappointing from the inside (especially if you have to queue for hours to get in...) In fact, the inside is empty and apart from a closer view at the tower's facade and a look from the top terrase (overcrowded) on the river and bridge there is nothing much to justify the price of the visit. Save your time and money for a drink a the feet of the tower instead !

Disappointin. On the day we visited there were lots of visitors, so access to side rooms was strictly controlled. The view from the top was not very special but crowded, there are many opportunities to view the panorama. More information about the tower would have been welcome.

97 steps that felt like 197!. This was a fascinating place and worth the trek to the top. If you have a Lisbon card you can get in free so we walked to the front of the queue which was handy. Sill need to queue to get up to the top though.

Beautiful. Very nice tower in the extremity of Lisbon. You can walk by the sea there are also a few restaurants and it is walking distance from other sites of interests (geronimos, park, pasteis do belem). There is also there boats trips that offer a great overview of the city.
Impressive. Very impressive location and building, in spite of the cold windy and rainy day. Would love to see it again in better weather.
worth a visit. Worth visiting this tower as interesting history and great views from the top. Entry is not expensive.

Nice Architecture. A witness of Portugals past glory and wealth!
The tower looks like it has been cut from a fairy tale.
Do climb the tower and enjoy the gorgeous view over the bay!
It poured!. We were there in a very heavy rainstorm and got drenched, but really enjoyed imagining the great Portuguese fleets departing in The Age of Discovery.

Morning Delight. Love this monument. It is immediately at the mouth of the river entering Lisbon, I cannot believe it ever had any strategic value , however, I can understand its role in controlling traffic and collecting taxes, neat building see it first hand!

Great views, long wait to climb the tower. This is a 'must do' while in Lisbon, and the climb to the top of the tower provides spectacular views. However, we waited an age to climb up and there appeared to be no warning about how steep and spiral the stairs were which might be disastrous for the infirm or those who are not feeling fit.

Good place for a picnic. Lovely place, the tower is by the sea and there is a largr green area in front of it where you can seat and have a picnic.
The tower itself is quite impressive, and it's easy to get there with either bus or tram lines.

Long lines. We waited in line for about 45 min. and there wasn't much do see or do inside. We had the Lisbon card and we're a little disappointed that we couldn't skip the line like with other city cards. When you do make it in you will have to wait in another line to actually climb the tower to the top, and you can only be up there for a small amount of time before having to go back down. It was interesting but with so many other museums and the monastery close by you may want to go to some of those if your time is limited.

Nice walk . Beware this walk on a hot day - there is little shade after the park on the way. Tower was impressive. Nice park around it. You have to pay to use the bathroom in the very expensive cafe which you can redeem against a purchase.

Well-preserved medieval tower on nice promenade. The Belem tower is located on a very nice promenade by the water. The tower itself offers a very well-preserved medieval construction with the possibility to go the the top - expect a line for the stairs that are to narrow for two-way traffic.Free with Lisboa-card. Buy combo-ticket with Jeronimo Monastery and skip the line one of the places.
Stunning. This was by far my favourite sight in lisbon. It is stunning with lots of quirky places to drink wine and relax

Nice area. The whole area around the torre is great not just the tower itself. It makes for a nice day out. The entry price is above what I think it is worth, but it is still a nice building to see from the outside.

Good view of the river and Belem. The view will cost you a good climb, including a 93 stair spiral staircase. I felt the view was worth it though. It is humbling to think of how many monumental voyages started from this area.

A little overrated. Nice view. But you could probably see the same view without the hassle of paying to go up the tower. The last entrance up is 5pm and you can get a combo ticket with the monestry. Bring your student id and it's half price.
Long cues. Only allows 120 people up at a time so you cue for the first level then cue again to go to the top. Pretty and good view but the waiting lines ruined it for me.

Must see. The owner of our appartment was quite reserved about the "many steps to climb" she said. It's wrong. Be brave, these steps are not so much and that difficult, and both the view that the fascination of the place are well worth the small effort.Notre logeuse émettait quelques réserves quant aux "trop nombreuses marches" disait-elle. C'est faux. Soyez courageux, ces marches ne sont pas si ardues, et tant la vue que la fascination de l'endroit valent bien le petit effort.
Don't go inside. What a pityYou have to wait too longFirst for the ticketSecond for the tower accessThe view is not exceptionalAnd the inside buildings deco tooDon't waist your time

Great 360 degree view. You may have to wait in line because they only let 120 people at a time and all 120 people have to exit before the next group is allowed in. We waited about 30 min. While you're waiting in line you have amazing views of the ocean all around that only that much more beautiful from the top of the tower.
An overrated place. There is nothing to see inside; just an small castle. To climb up to tower and go down; you wait a lot. Its a waste of time.

Amazing medieval landmark. Viewed the tower from the outside at all angles and took some brilliant photos. Clear model at entrance highlights exact build. Lovely to see, quite a walk from Belem but very pleasant in sun and worth it.

interesting but long queue. interesting and worth a visit if in belem - just be mindful that only so many people are allowed in at once & the bridge were you wait in line is not in the shade - nice though
Stunning architecture. A must see when in Lisbon. A little gem of a tower, with stunning architecture and views.Try and avoid visiting when busy as some of the rooms are very small.
A castle...of sorts I think. Not quite sure what it is.But its nice to sit and look at it whilst having a breather as you walk along the river bank
Must see. The place is fabulous. The picture of the tower with the water.Not must to go inside.The walk side to the river also nice.Can stop for drinks bear the river.

Landmark of Lisbon. The Tower of Belem is slightly outside the city center. Take a taxi to get there and don't worry because they are cheap in Lisbon. Indeed a little smaller than pictures will show but still quite impressive. Also because of its location (along the river).Combine this attraction with the monastery dos Jeronimos which is within walking distance. Also there is a great walking path along the river.
Can't loose it. Lisbon is an amazing city and Torre de Belém is one of the most famous historic point of the city. Amazing view from Tejo River and Ponte 25 de Abril.
Great to learn about history. Great place to learn about history of Portugal and leading force in spice route development. Very relaxing walk along the sea with various museums across the road.
Beautiful . This tower is at sea and have nice park around. The entrants fee i think is a little expansive but the tower is beautiful :)

Unimpressive. Unless you like queueing.. One of Lisbon's best-known landmarks, but unimpressive. There is very little information (and virtually none in English) about the history of the tower - it's basically just a set of mostly empty rooms. There's a queue to get in, and then another to get up to the tower (we waited at least 30 mins in that one). There is a complicated one-way system in the stairwell, which doesn't work, so we spent some claustrophobic minutes stuck halfway down the stairwell with people on either side. The view from the top is okay, but nothing special.

A landmark. If you visit the convent and the Tower, buy a combined ticket, it will be 2€ cheaper. The tower is not that big, but has beautiful views over the river. You might have to queue to get to the top of the tower, and it will take at least half an hour, they only take 120 persons in one go, but if you have paid to enter, it is worth to wait a bit longer to get to the top.
