Outside better than inside!. The tower of Belem is part of the UNESCO WORLD heritage sites and is truly a masterpiece of architecture on the outside. You can hardly believe that it was built as a defensive structure as it would have been a pity to destroy it by cannon fire. The interiors are far less impressive and consist of subterranean holding cells, hallway of cannons, the parapets and the top of the tower. I omitted going to the top of the tower since there was quite a queue to visit it due to the confined premises on the top.

Looks almost unreal, staircase to the top can be chaotic. When I saw this castle for the first time, I though it was something out of this world, just completely unreal. Just floats in the water, very beautiful.There is not a lot of things to see or do inside, but the views are great. Lots of good photo opportunities. I really liked sitting in the little turrets with my wife and taking photos.There is a very small winding staircase that takes you up the top of the tower. It does not allow people to ascend and descend at the same time. They implemented a green and red light system to monitor the flow of people climbing the stairs. No one followed it, so it was just chaos. People pushing, yelling, and getting frustrated at each other. You can either sit and wait forever or be take action - that was me.Other than that, totally worth going.
Stunning piece of architecture and history.. Beautiful monument and structure right on the water. Great history behind it's construction. Definitely worth visiting if making over to Belem.
Beautiful Architecture. Must to see if you are in the area, but be prepared to wait to get in as it does get very busy, I opted to admire from the outside and take some pictures, Glad i visited.

Wonderful building but chaotic inside. Torre de Belem is a lovely building and I certainly recommend a visit. It is worth visiting with a combined ticket with the other attractions in Belem, especially if you spend a whole day in the Belem area. There are nice vistas from the monument and the tower has interesting history.However, it is very busy even in November when I visited last year. The queueing system is quite chaotic: there was confusion at the entrance's bridge (lashed by the tides!) and the stairs system inside the tower did not operate efficiently. The tower terrace's views are not as good as those at Padrao dos Descobrimentos; less worth the effort in comparison to that monument.

Just another Tower - better go to Mosteiro dos Jeronimos. First of all take care of your wallet in the tram 15!!!! The Torre de Belem is nice but better you use your time at the Mosteiro dos Jeronimos

Cakes and towers. Pasteis de Belem are worth the bus ride alone and the Tower of Belem is a must for history fans. Gets busy though and we queued for thirty minutes so go early or buy online and skip queues.
Vasco de Gama is buried in the church by the monastery which is of interest
Nice walk along the sea but avoid the gypsies. Nice walk to the tower from the monastery, but many gypsies there selling fakes so be careful, but this area is nice so worth a visit.

Lovely piece of history thats worth seeing - but is very busy.. We did Belem and the Mosteiro dos Jeronimos easily on same day in a leisurely way. Easy access by bus/metro/taxi. Can take a tuk tuk between Monastery and Belem pretty cheaply if you need to. Belem is a lovely monument in wonderful setting. Went early October and was still very busy with long queues to get in. Agree with previous comment that its better from the outside. Makes great photo opportunity. Nice park surrounding where you can sit and enjoy the view at leisure.

Interesting if the tide is in and a strong wind blowing!. make sure you go at low tide if you want to avoid running the gauntlet of high waves. Many who got soaked trying to cross the bridge providing great entertainment to those watching. Not much top see once inside

great monument, a must-see when in Lisbon. one of the most interesting monuments in Lisbon, approximately 20 minutes by metro/bus from the city centre. On Sundays admission is free. You can visit the Belem Tower by walking 10 minutes from the Monasterio dos Jeronimos and Monument Padraos dos Descobrimentos, so in 1 day you can enjoy 3 beautiful sights!
Enjoy the area and the outside, miss going inside. I think the outside and the whole area is beautiful and a must do in Lisboa. Don't think going inside is worth the time or money.
Worth the visit. got wet by walking into the tower. Nothing much to see but historic. Well preserved. Surrounding is beautiful.

Very BUSY - But very QUIRKY. This really great monument from Portugal's golden age is a real gem. I would move in tomorrow, very busy though, the stairs can be a pain esp when other visitors have not grasped the concept of the traffic light system used on them.Buy a ticket to do this and the Mosteiro dos Jeronimos for a discounted rate.Cafe next to it with toilets - ask for a ticket

We were definately not alone. Packed with tourists trying to get in. Very (!) long waiting line. If you want to visit get your tickets in advance to avoid the queue. We didn't so we were not even able to get in without waiting an hour in line. We skipped this and only looked at it from the outside which is impressive enough.

Not worth the queue in the rain. The tower is better viewed from outside. We had to queue in the rain whilst one of the staff was absent (tea break maybe?) and quite honestly it wasn't worth the wait.

Worth a visit. Well renovated and maintained. All little sparse on artifacts. about 93 steps of a spiral staircase to top of tower, but worth it for the view. Long quay to get back down though lucky rain stopped while we were waiting. Definitely worth a visit.

One of the most iconic Monuments in Lisbon. If you are coming to Lisbon this is one of the monuments you can't miss. It was erected when Portugal discovered most of the know world. The surrounding area is also one of the most beautiful in Lisbon with several museums and galleries. Also nearby is the famous Custard Tart or as we call it PASTEL DE BELEM. The real one!!!

Interesting architecture. The tower is beautiful and worth going up. It is besteht visited outside the rush hours otherwise it is a battle to go up and down the stairs. despite a very good system has been put in place to regulate the up and down stream, most tourists ignore it or are not able to unterstand the logic.

Beautiful to to see, not worth to go inside.. It's a shame it is quite far out of the city. Maybe it's nice if it's part of your bus tour. Entrance if not expensive, but still not worth going inside. Just not that much to see.
Only When Absent Giant Tour Buses. Once a state of the art military defense installation in the river, now a tourist Mecca on dry land. I wouldn't wait in line but rather observe from the plaza.

High tides meant no queue but we did get wet!. We read reviews and decided in advance not to go in because of the queues. When we got there, however there were no queues because the high spring tides meant the waves were crashing through and over the little wooden bridge to the tower. Only a few brave people braving the run and a crowd of spectators cheering them on and taking videos. It was possible to get across without getting wet you just have to be patient - we got all the way to the entrance before a wave took us from behind but that was because people wouldn't move in enough for us to get to safety. Not a lot in there but the dash across was fun and it was worth the €6 each to get in.
worthy visit. This is a historical place to see in lisbon. great to visit all the year dont miss, you can find portuguese history here
perfect location. From the tour you have a perfect view on the river Tejo. It is a recommended place for tourists. The tour can be reached from Lisbon on foot in about half an hour.
Beautiful!. Didn't go inside but took lots of photos. The tide was a little too high to go on the walkway. It was splashing people that day. Well worth seeing.
Breathtaking. Very beautiful architecture! We were fortunate to have one day of sunshine on our short vacation here. Expect to see many vendors selling selfie sticks!

Too busy. You can reach it after stop the railway station in Belem, you walk on the seafront after the Padrao dos Descobrimentos and you find it with one queue of 1 hour in the front. Very bad the system to visit up and down the tower.Ok it's nice. the tower who defend Lisbon for many years, but 2 points less for the traffic jam of human
So-so stop in Lisbon. Well....it is a small-ish tower close to the river and the ocean with some history. I might be ignorant, but it is nice, nothing special.

A popular attraction and rightly so.. A worthwhile visit well presented and taking you back to a time when the tower was part of Lisbon's defences. Thoroughly enjoyed the visit despite the number of visitors.

great architecture. It is an amazing architectural treasure, beautiful but not easy to get to. We walk from the Monastery of Jeronimos. It has limited capacity so be prepare to queue and wait to get in and then there is only narrow staircase up (no lift if you have mobility problems) it has a system red and green lights to regulate moving up and down the staircase. We went towards the end of the day and was not so busy. Great for taking amazing pictures. It could be better explained, more information and maybe audio guide. Has potential to be much better. It is covered by Lisboa Card.
De Belem. nice place to visit, Torre with sea view, got many tourist come here. also many people do exercise here. easy to come here with tram.
Interesting monument. The Torre de Belem is right on the waters edge, and with green space on the other side. We encountered too long a line up to go into the tower.
Brilliant a must see. Another shining example of wonderful Architecture and craftsmanship. .. A magical experience to visit all these amazing monuments in Lisbon

Not worth the queues. We went to see the tower on a Sunday morning joining the long snaking queue outside. We waited - bracing ourselves against biting winds alternating with mild showers - to go in. What made this wait of over two hours unbearable was the fact that tour groups were allowed to go in ahead of us! Why? Because they have a ticket. Well, we'll have a ticket too, once you allow us to reach the ticket window, which is the near the entryway, which you can only get to after standing in the stupid queue. And they allow only 120 people in at a time, so the queue moved at snail's pace - each of the four tour groups that was allowed to skip the queue added 15 minutes to our wait time. The staff were absolutely unsympathetic. Why cant tour groups join the same queue? After all, we're all paying the same money to get in. If there is a pre-booking option, it should be open to everyone.The staff just kept shrugging and saying, everyday is same. What's that even supposed to mean? Several people gave up and left the queue. For the more patient ones who braved it out and went in, the tower itself was a disappointment- empty and offering some views of the sea. But if it is views you are craving, you are better off at one of the city's many Miraduoros - free, in abundance, and with no rude staff to contend with!PS - If Portugal really wants tourists, they need to work on the staff, the attractiosn, and importantly, the tickets. The ones we were handed looked like supermarket receipts.Put a picture, put the amount, make it memorable, not nightmarish.

WORTH it only if you have Lisbon card. This attraction is overrated, it costs a lot considering the prices in Lisbon, it's a long cue, and there is only a one way steps, you have to wait a lot!It's free if you buy the Lisbon card, but you don't skip the lines!Long cue, better spend time elsewhere. It's best that you photograph the attraction and then just leave!You visit in 20-30 minutes and wait one hour to get in and one hour to get out, even in Octomber. It;s limited to 120 persons at one time, hence the long cue!if you take the 15E( TRAM number 15) direction Alges you can get off at Mosteiro Jeronimos and walk or two stops after Mosteiro Jeronimos and walk a rampart across the road!

Worth visiting.. This is a very nice tower and worth a look at if visiting the city. Unfortunately never got to go inside due to the long queues and our limited time there. The tower was erected as a tribute to St Vincent (the patron saint of Lisbon) by King John II, it is an iconic piece of history and well worth a visit.
Tower with view . It's interesting tower with beautiful view. Not much inside, looks better from outside. Beautiful view from the tower.

A nice but empty tower with a good view to the sea. We enjoyed our visit of the tower of Belem. Nevertheless, the visit was very quick mainly due to the fact that the tower is empty: no exhibition, nothing and just very few information. You can go all the way up though (mind the arrows for the direction changing every 90sec as the staircase is very narrow) and from there you have quite a nice view to the sea and the 25th of april bridge. Entrance fee is 6€, which is quite a lot for such a short visit but we had the Lisboa card and visited 6 monuments/museums on that day so that was worth it (free with Lisboa card, only take it if you are not a student!!).

The exterior is the main interest. We found the queue excessive because only 120 people at a time are allowed in, which is problematic when groups can bypass you. Note that as elsewhere the Lisbon Card gives you free entry but you still have to queue for a ticket.

Very picturesque. On a nice day it is a very pleasant walk from public transportation and offers great views of the river if you climb up the winding staircase inside the tower. Nice day trip from Lisbon although the tram was packed to capacity from the first stop.

Average Experience. As it is an iconic attraction within Lisbon probably worth a visit to see however the interior has limited facilities, two way staircases with passing room for one set of people and queues are very poorly managed (1+ hours).

European Beer Trekkers visit October 2015.. Just had to visit the Belem Tower as it is one of the defining images of Lisbon. It made me think of the Portuguese seamen who sailed passed it on their way to discovering the shipping routes around the coast of Africa to discover India.. A great nation of seafarers. Well worth a visit. One should not visit Lisbon without taking in this historic landmark.

Interesting Tower. As a photographer I found the surrounding cobble stone patterns more interesting. It is a good stop if you have time during your stay in Lisbon. Did not visit inside. Popular tourist stop.There is a small market area and bathroom (fee) nearby.

Worth a visit. This tower is stunning on the outside and while inside you can get some wonderful views . Be aware of the traffic light when trying to go up and down the tower . It really worth a visit . Lots of buses go there. Free with the Lisboa card to enter .

Great views. Really interesting building a good start to exploring round Belem. The Tower was super busy when we went and we had to queue to get up and down the narrow stairs! There isn't much information on the history of the tower apart from a video so would recommend reading up before you leave!

Best for Hanging Out in Area Around the Tower. Once you get off the tram or bus and walk past the large museums, you can weave your way into the quiet part of town to the pedestrian bridge over the highway. Once you walk over it, you can get a white port/orange juice treat or other wines and hang out along the water on the cement wall. You have a great view of the 25-April bridge (like the Golden Gate).
Very nice, very busy. This is a visually spectacular little castle that has a one-way stairway to the top not for those with claustrophobia! Worth a look though.
A nice place. we went there on Monday it was closed but the surrounding is nice one can seat in the Cafe near the water and enjoy the place also

Beautiful view. It just so happened that I booked a 3 hour bike tour from bikeiberia, and that's how I ended up visiting the tower. I also had a good view of it when doing my cruise on the Tagus river.

Disappointing. This tower looks wonderful on the outside and its situation is superb. However, it is disappointing inside. Not much to see and a traffic light system to climb up the internal steps to be able to see the view at the top. The internal narrow stairs are claustrophobic and give a limited time to climb before you have to get off the stairway to let people pass going in the opposite direction. Worth looking at from the outside but not worth the cost to go inside.
Worth a day trip. Walking through this historic structure gives you an idea that it must have been horrific for prisoners who were imprisoned there. It offers great views.
Worth to visit. Torre de Belem is worth the visit, not only is UNESCO site, it gives you a great of the harbour, the stair is narrow though.
beautiful landmark. beautiful landmark, not easy to reach, we went their at night ..... guess took us 5km to make a u-turn on the way back to the city
Nice area. Nothing so special. However, the atmosphere was so intersting. There was strong winds and we could'nt enjoy the place enough.

Well restored 14th - 15th century fortress. A bit away from the hub bub of old town Lisbon. But well worth the time to visit this fortress. Combine the visit with the Archeological Museum and the National Art and Antiquities Museum for a full day.

Better from the outside, I'd say. We spent an hour in the line waiting to get in, as it was first Sunday of the month, when lots of places are free entry, apparently. Hence long queue and only 120 people inside at any one time. Had we known that, we might not have bothered. Fairly standard 'fortification' stuff inside, from the cells below ground, up the various levels to the top, with its turrets and views over the river. There is info on the ground floor with history, which is interesting, if you want to stay to read it all (hordes of people all pushing along make it not that easy...)

Not worth the price tag to go in. Beautiful structure, but not really worth going inside. Chose between climbing this and the explorer monument next door. Gets pretty crowded inside and you have to alternate between those trying to go up and down the incredibly narrow stairs. Not for the claustrophobic or impatient.
Great bit of history. A must if you like history and like brilliant views. We took a taxi from Lisbon and it only cost EUR10. otherwise there is public transport.

Go there in the sunset. I was there I went up the tower in the sunset after eating the Pasteis de belem that are near the tower.Impressing view of the Atlantic.If you are in Lisbon don’t miss the sunset there
Closed Mondays. . Only could admire from the outside as it was closed. Lovely structure though in a wonderful less hectic area. On the water so great to take photos and cool off with a breeze.
Interesting!. Take the tram out to this stop. We walked from the monument of the discoveries to here and it was quite a hike. Nice to climb to the top for the view.
Must see. Something in good weather, nice place nice view. Worth to go up in the tower to see the view and a mid interesting exhibition.

Landmark building in a gorgeous riverside setting. Unlike us, make sure you enter by 5:00; the building is open until 6:00, but the last admission is one hour before closing. We walked all around the outside instead, which I understand is the more interesting part. It's a beautiful setting and lovely ti walk to on a hot, sunny day. Allegedly it was the last thing on land that sailors saw before heading out to sea. It's hard to take your eyes off it!

Go before monastery. The queue can get long so try to head there around 10 am to avoid waiting too long. Take cash if possible as the card machine does not work well. Nice views so try to go in nice weather. Each floor is quite similar. Overall views are quite pretty.

Nice view. We took a tuk-tuk out to the Torre de Belem - is recommended as it is cheaper and you will see more. However at the Torre there is not much to see. We took a stroll along the pier and watched the people and that was nice.

Worth a close up look; good photo shoot.. A stop off on our guided tour of Lisbon. Some of the group climbed the steps for the view but with clever camera angling excellent photos can be taken from ground level. Normally quite a lot of people around so again skill is needed in getting relatively crowd freeshots but it is worth the effort.Interesting architecture of its period.

nice history but not particularly large. 6e entrance fee per person, and you are able to self tour yourself around the site. It is worth it. Go up into the tower, and enjoy the view from top. The windy stair case (believe it said 93 steps) has several floors along the way. But it is extremely narrow passage (one direction at a time - cant safely do two columns of people at once) and very tight radius circle. Had a nice system that told you when to ascend and descend from the various floors to keep the traffic on stairs moving and safe. Except most people tried to ignore it making it a bit more time consuming. But worth the stop and price.

Majestic!. The gorgeous and majestic white tower was completed in 1519 after nearly 5 years’ construction. However, it only served its original purpose (to protect Lisbon’s harbor) for 60 years. After Spanish forces defeated Portuguese the tower had been served as a prison for 250 years! Belém Tower classified as UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1983.

Great History of Lisbon and Portugal . This is a must go to see historical site. So much history and culture. Every time I ho there I put myself back into History when Torre de Belém was such an important part of what made Portugal a super power.
Disappointed visit. Doesn't look as good as you think it would. No really nice detailing. ..And they ask 6 Euro to look inside. .I didn't go inside because I was so disappointed from the exterior.
Nice old tower. Easy to get to by public transport. It is a nice tower, we did not go in, because there was a line waiting.
Fab. Lovely little tower with great views across the river from the top. Free to get in if you have a Lisbon Card.
Be prepared to climb.. Definitely worth visit. The tower is very pretty with an interesting history and nice view from the top. Be prepare to climb, very narrow stairs.

THE most popular photo opportunity in Lisbon. It's a beautiful walk at the Tejo to get to the Torre de Belem(built between 1514 and 1520). The views from the Torre on the Tejo are the most breathtaking when the sun shines;-) The spiral staircase inside the tower only goes one way and are ruled by red & green "traffic" lights. Combination ticket with the Mosteiro dos Jeronimos recommended.

Worth the wait in line to get in. Very interesting site, all the information boards have an English translation and, as the numbers are restricted because of the climb up the narrow staircase to the top level of the tower, it doesn't get too crowded to be able to see things properly. Great views too.

A true icon of Portugal. This monument is one of the most important in Portugal, not for being big or ashtonishing but for its meaning. It is a beautiful building built inside the Tejo river. You can enter the building by crossing a bridge. The surroundings (gardens, marina, restaurants) are very good for walking or running. To see the sunset in the summer is amazing.

If you like steps and crowds this is for you.. Be warned this attraction is very very busy. Try and get here early as all the tourist buses stop here. Because of the layout of the building the access is number limited so prepare to queue. We got in fairly quickly but when we left the sign was saying an hours wait to go in. The tower itself is interesting but it is just a tower and the information boards were poor. There are great views from the tower back to Lisbon, note there are lots of steps for the less able. Given the crowds and the poor information I would take a picture from the outside and save the entrance fee.
Interesting Place. Its small yet interesting, good views down river you need to be a bit fit to climb inside narrow stairs, you can buy entry ticket for the Monastery here which is close by
Goods to look at. We didn't bother queuing to go in - it was Sunday. So we went into the pastries shop instead and had custard tarts! These were lovely and great service. Nice to wonder around.
Worth it. Part of Portugese history and should be seen and a wonderful place for a walk and a lunch/ drink on a sunny day.

Great historical site. Torre de Belem is a lovely place to visit the price is a bit steep but it is almost justified. You can combine this sight with the monastery as well. Word of warning though try to go early morning or evening to avoid the awful tours! As it gets crowded fast and only 120 people are allowed in at one time.
Worth a look. We didn't go in thought it was expensive at 12 euros but very attractive building and surroundings took some good photos and bought a glass of wine and sat by the river lovely!
Beautiful.... It is the place where the Portuguese Explorers would embark on expeditions to discover the World. By the Tagus river. We did not do the inside of the tower which has an entry fee.

this tower stands out from the port. if you've seen photographs of this tower, then theres really no point in trekking out by train to this monument. the nearest train stop to this torre is about 20-30min walk.. and uneventful.
I LOVE BELEM!!!. its probaly the best place ive ever been to so much to do there amazing view of the vasca da gama bridge

Another "must see" in Lisbon. Lisbon is a small town (compared to other european cities like Paris, London, Madrid) but with lot of history to tell and see. "On" the "Tejo" river, this is a piece of Portugal and Lisbon history that you must see.

A must see but crowded. A must see in Belem (tram 15 from Lisbon and then quite a long walk). We did not enter as it was so crowded and felt that we could see and admire most of what we wanted from the outside. I was last here about 25 years ago and had forgotten how far it from the Discovery Monument. The trams and buses between Belem and Lisbon were very crowded!

NICE VIEW OVER THE TAGUS RIVER ! HISTORIC LISBON !. Very antic bulding ! More than 500 years ! It´s an atraction to spend 30 minutes Max. Just go up and enjoy the higher View of Tagus River and Belem area ! Very Biutiful !!

A True Landmark. Designated as a UNESCO heritage site, for the Portuguese, this tower is quite significant not only for its distinctive architectural design, but also for the role it has played in the country's maritime history. Too bad, it was not open when we visited, but we were able to take some closeup photos. It would be good to spend time and marvel at this 4-story structure, which had served as part of the defense at the mouth of the Tagus river, and also as a launching point for the explorers of that time, aptly called the "Age of Discoveries."
Dicovering the world. A beautiful fortress that was in the middle of the river . We're Portuguese sail to discovery of the new world . A place that It's possible to lose
beautiful old tower. Great pictures of a 500 year old tower along the Tagus river in Lisbon. This is a must see for all visitors to Lisbon. Originally on an island and now on the river bank.

One of the most beautiful fortresses in the world!. The title says it all! It is small but its architecture is very rich. On its neighbourhood there are atractions to spend a couple of days visiting so... your problem will be the choice.

Interesting piece of history. This is a very cool tower, medieval style located on the Targus River. The structure is very common for the era, has terrace with decent views along with small individual towers that were occupied to defend the tower. It is just a very cool structure excellent place for families with kids.

historic. Only 120 people allowed in at a time and you could be standing outside for 30 minutes and a Tour bus pulls up and 50 -60 people get to go front of line. After the long waits a bit of a let down!

Worth the trip on the tram. We visited the Torre after seeing the Jeromimos Monastery, and wasn't disappointed. We didn't go in as the queue was too long but we liked the outside with its references to Portugal's maritime past. Nearby is the Combatents museum and the national monuments to Portuguese serving abroad (an eternal flame burns in the middle of a water feature) which was nice to look at.

Nice from the outside. We stopped here while on a Mediterranean cruise and our tour did not allow us to go inside, but we got some pretty amazing pictures of the outside. We will definitely have to come again to Lisbon so we can tour the inside of this fortress. Was even more beautiful when our cruise ship sailed away that evening and we saw it from our balcony. Such amazing history in the city of Lisbon!

Free entry day!. We went on the first Sunday of the month, which was free. So did most of Lisbon! It was busy, but the queue was worth it. The tower is small, but has good views over the river. Worth a visit, perhaps on a quieter day!

Quick Visit. Fascinating glimpse of the last remnants of a fortress where many of the Portuguese explorers first started their voyages. The tower was in very good shape, and you could tour through it, but we did not. It was close to other monuments, but did have a lot of street hawkers trying to sell merchandise like IPhone Selfee Sticks.
Stunning!. Absolutely must place to see while in Lisbon, beautiful building set on the riverside with great views. Worth taking a walk to the military memorial close by also.
A must see. This is a beautiful structure, right on the water and so much details on the structure, There was a long line to get in so be prepared. A must see.
Impressive. Good restored point of interest. Reminds the times of Portuguese magnificence at the past. Enough to observe outside not to stand in line long.

Nice from the outside . It was closed when we got there, so only saw the inside. Was pretty chilly in October, and right by the water, so bring a jacket. Might be a good idea to also take a river tour when you're in the area.

One of the most famous monuments of Lisbon. This tower really worths a visit. If you have a Lisboacard your entrance here is free. Be prepared for walking many stairs,there is no lift here as it is a building of the XVI century.

Worth the visit especuially on a nice day. Worth going to visit, especially if you are I the area seeing the other sites.We got a glass of wine from a local vendor and just sat by the river. Was very relaxing. The tower is interesting and if you are up for it go to the top.To be honest we enjoyed hanging around outside the most.
Long queue. Whole area very busy on a Sunday with people visiting Mosteiro dos Jeronimos and Padrão dos Descobrimentos. Long queue to access the Torre de Belem but external view good enough.

Tower so-so. The Belem' Tower is a Lisbon historic landmark on the riverbank. Pretty from the outside but there are other sites more scenic and historic. Seems like the hype is more than the substance. The crowds make this a real effort to see. (We were there on a Sunday so maybe busier than usual). Believe there are better easy to spend your valuable Lisbon time.

Medieval fort in the river.. Fort guarding the entrance to Lisbon built over 400 years ago,impressive to climb the 93 stairs to the top ,however the stairs are both narrow and steep not recommended if your are disabled,Views from the battlements over look the whole river.

Go to see. The Tower is also a must do in Lisbon. It is worth it to see in daylight and nighttime. I did not go in since basically it is a spiral staircase and that is it. The tower is very beautiful and admirable.

Perhaps not worth the queue. It's definitely worth going there to see the outside, which it does look better from. Waiting in the line to get in is questionable. It's nice to say you have been inside but the only difference is standing on that little platform seeing the side of the tower from the harbor side. The view from the top you can get from other attractions in the area.

Quick and scenic views. This is a quick harbor-side attraction that won't take long to visit. It's really more interesting from the outside and there's a very nice park surrounding this whole area that's worth a stroll if you want to see where Christopher Columbus departed for his New World expeditions.
A Beautiful Landmark ... especially at nite!. Went first at nite to avoid the crowds ... then again in the morning with a tour group ... which 'tho more "informative" ... wasn't nearly as enjoyable.

Turned away despite having Lisboa card!. Interesting and historic building in gorgeous position on the Tagus, advertised opening times were ignored, and many people queuing turned away today despite having been waiting for some time whilst others were ushered straight past the queue, with no reasonable explanation.
Beautiful!!. Torre de Belem is a wonderful place to see! It is absolutely breathtaking. Make sure to bring a camera!

A medieval tour in Belem. I would have given this sight higher marks but the day we went to visit it was a national holiday so access was free and the tower closed early as they had too many visitors .. bummer. While the tower is beautiful to look at outside with architectural detail that is similar to Jeronimos Monastery I guess I'll have to go back to Lisbon so I can see the inside...

A Formidable Protector . This landmark offers magnificent views from its various towers. The view of the Rio Tego River is wonderful. Be aware that climbing the tower's steps can be challenging as the steps are narrow and people are entering and exiting at the same time. A view of the interior is worth the admission.

Confusing but good views. Average experience but good views. To get to the top of the tower you need to go up 93 steps in a very narrow stairwell. As you are going up the narrow staircase as it only allows single file & they have a system where a bell rings you need to exit the staircase so the other direction can have right of way. However it is unclear who has right of way and when. Basically it was chaos with 20-30 tourists on each level trying to go up or down and no one knew if you could go up or down. There was lighting to indicate but this wasn't working on most levels.
Belém is one of the most beautiful areas of Lisbon. Great visit Belém is beautiful. if the Lisbon visit Belém, because there are many monuments, museums and the famous pastel de Belém.
Quite pretty . Lovely to look at, especially at sunset. We were a little late so we couldn't go in unfortunately. Well worth a visit.

Photogenic but watch the queues. Amazingly building but queues form quickly as they limit the number of people. The Tower has a weird one way system to get you from floor to floor via the spiral stairway. Note that the building is 'empty'.

A cool area to explore and learn historical facts. The whole area is nice to walk around and explore and take pictures. The tower was very cool to see, especially climbing all the way to the top and seeing those views. It's a lot of stairs but very interesting to walk through such an old place and the views up top are worth it!

Nice to hang out. its a nice area to hang out and do nothing but lay down, eat something and enjoy with friends and family. All tourists come here but it doesnt seem to be too busy. Easy to take a taxi (we stayed at Alfama) rather than public transport

tourist attraction. Lovely little area, the tower was not accessible when we visited and I'm not sure whether you can visit inside or not) but it draws a crowd. Super little cafe just across the grassed area.

Lovely architecture. Very impressive. Be aware of the ring system that tells you to leave the stairs as it is limitrd to 120 people. Amazing stone work. You can easily walk down to the discovery monument then use the underpass to get to the monastery.

Ancient protector of the harbor. This Manueline style tower is one of the main landmarks of Lisbon. It is open for tourists to view the inside of what has served for centuries as a main protector of the harbor.
Great for half day visit. Went for afternoon whilst in Lisbon. Easy to get to via bus.Lovely walking along the river, with plenty of parks, restaurants and sights.But be aware can be very windy.

Nice walk in the embankment. Very nice atmosphere; do not go inside.
Nice stroll in the embankment .good views over the harbor
Amazing story on Portugal Brazil flight 1922

Great view. If you combine the ticket with the Monasteiro, it's really worth it! Once you get through the long waiting line, you can enjoy an amazing view over the sea and get to enjoy the beautiful towers architecture.
Nice sight for a quick visit. Imposing structure. The architecture is interesting. However, there was a long line to go inside so we skip touring the interior.

Not worth getting inside.. Overrated. Is basically just an old tower with nothing to see but the view from he top. Which is not that high also.Way too expensive for what it offers. You can get much more better views from the monument which is 3 times higher and cheaper. Also the stairs are very narrow allowing a person at a time. While there is a green/red light people don't respect it. It takes half an hour just to get up an down. My advice, go there, take a picture with the tower as the landscape is beautiful than head to the monument if you want the views.

an iconic building. You will be familiar with this building as it's on almost every advert for Lisbon, there is a discount on entry if you have the Lisbon card. It's pretty empty inside, there is a narrow spiral staircase that takes you up to the very top level with rooms on each level that are empty, it's 93 steps to the top, views across Belem and the river.

Pretty place. On the day we visited it was heavy rain ! We had caught the tail end of a hurricane! It was also a Monday and there are NO MUSEUMS open on Mondays, therefore we could not go inside which was a shame.
A great view. As part of our Vantage Douro River trip that included 3 nights in Lisboa, we enjoyed this exhibit as part of our city tour.
Not much surprise. Just an ordinary tower on the beach. Not much to see inside though it is well preserved. Good to take a few photos with it as the background.

Picturesque and iconic tower in a beautiful setting. This picturesque tower on the shores of the Tagus river has become an icon of the glorious period of Portuguese exploration. It is not open to visitors but the view alone is worth the trip to Belem in conjunction with the other attractions round about.
Interesting place to visit wet or warm day. Interesting place to visit, not dear by any stretch of the imagination, if you go to Belem you have to see this place

Just ok. The tower was not very exciting. The movie didn't work and the way to go up and down the narrow staircase was confusing and can get very stressful when crowded. Don't go if you are even slightly claustrophobic! If you decide to visit the tower get a combi ticket with the monastery so you'll only end up paying two extra Euros for the tower which is allright.
What a tower!. The Torre de Belém is quite near the Mosteiro dos Jerónimos. Very nice situated at the rio Tejo. Beautiful mix of different building-styles. Seeing it is a must. What a tower!

Incredibly grim experience. The tower is at the end of the long stretch of motorway that forms most of Belem. The only sensible way to get here is on a coach, but you might question why you bothered. The tower is an interesting sight, but no more than that. Belem is also almost entirely bereft of good value places to eat or drink and so you'll be out of here quite quickly.
Very nice place to visit. Impressive monument localized near the water. Very nice sunset. Good place to photography. Go around the building and also in front for very good photos.

An OK visit if you're in the area. So it's picturesque. From the outside the tower looks good. But after queueing to get in there was little to get excited about. It must have been a depressing place to be stationed in! Worth a journey? Yes if you want to see as much as possible of Lisbon. But there are better things to see.My view was possibly coloured by visiting on the first Sunday of the month when entrance is free. It was packed!!! It was cheap, but I would have been happy to pay the entrance fee and have fewer crowds.
Great!. Lovely and very interesting place! Even if you are tired from all the walking, it is worth taking the effort to visit this! Great view!!!

If you miss you won't miss much. Very nice from the outside, the inside a little shabby. A hall with about 10 cannons, nothing more, the cellar not worth to go to. Usually a long queue in front of the tower as only 120 persons are allowed to be inside. The view from to top of the tower is less impressive than from the Monument.

Lisbon's ex libris. Present in almost all of Lisbon's postcards, Torre de Belém mixes function and beauty to form one of Portugal's most important monuments. Don't be distracted by its detailed and decorated outside - the privileged views over the Tejo and the heavy armory that once stood here make this one of the finest defensive constructions to be built in our country.Tickets go for 6€, but there's a conjoint ticket to the tower and the cloisters at Jerónimos that goes for 12€, which is a good deal. Last admission is at 17h00, even though it only closes at 18h30.
Beautiful. This is a little gem not often you find such a thing of beauty that also served as a fortress to protect Lisbon from invasion from the estuary. A must see along with the the monument.

Beautiful site. This place is amazing. So much history and much of it hasn't changed much. So nice to see that some things never change and history is preserved. I would higly recommend to visit this tower that still stands against the test of time.

Underwhelming. I hate to say it, as a history student but don't bother visiting Belem. It's swarming with tourists (tourist buses are everywhere!) and the whole place is rather unpleasant. It's next to a giant road, there is no signage if you're trying to find your way from the tower to the monastery and the area itself is run down and unattractive. We made a special effort to come here and were very disappointed. The tower itself is great but be prepared to be herded around there like cattle in a sea of morons holding selfie sticks...Not worth it.

Great visit. This is a great site. Easily accessible by tram, metro, train or bus. It is a beautiful tower and the area around it is so lovely. I would definitely recommend this as a must see when visiting Belem. I didn't get to go inside as there was a very long queue - so if you want to go in I suggest to get there early we got there at 11am and the queue was too long!

Attractiv building near the river. This building is really a tourist attraction which is a must, when you are in Lissabon. Even you can not enter the building, the place and the view are very attractiv.
Standing guard. Standing sentinel on the Tagus this early 16th century fort is not just a potent reminder of Portugal's seafaring history but a delightful Gothic style residence.

Great Place. We stay in Lisbon few days. And if you stay in Lisbon you absolutely should see the Belem tower.I had to warn you. - Do not go on Sunday (It's free only the first Sunday of the month);- Prepare your self, there are a lot of people and a huge queue (Especially on August);By the way the tower is fascinating.

Must do when visiting Lisbon. Must do when visiting Lisbon. This tower is the landmark of the history of the brave men who sailed the globe to discover the world. It is busy and especially the top floor observation deck can be crowded.
Lisbon's symbol. Read about it before you go or you’ll miss some of its beauty and meaning. Fabulous military architecture, great view and excellent walk on the riverside

Charming place. This is a must see when in Portugal. A mix of history and nice views can be admired when there. Take a walk by the water and enjoy a cafe or a refreshing drink in one of the those cafés nested there.

Torre de Belém, a fortress or a ship?. Built in the sixteenth century as a fortress to defend Lisbon, is today a wonderful monument to visit. In Manuelin Style it is a stone masterpiece...and in a shape of a ship.You can visit ancient rooms ( the fortress commander room ) and the dungeons and...the beautiful sight ... a mix of blue, green and white.

Beautiful Piece of Architecture. We were on a guided tour for the day, and this was one of our last stops on our way back. I'd definitely recommend coming here around sunset, because you will get some beautiful photos. We didn't climb up to the top or anything (I actually didn't know you could, our guide gave us a some info about the tower and its history, though). He just brought us to the little park area, and we went for a nice little walk in the park area and got some pictures, there was no entrance fee to just go look at the tower. We were here in the beginning of September, in the early evening, and I did not find it crowded here at all. It's situated next to a nice park area, not sure what the other reviewer constitutes "a particularly nice area" (they must have ridiculous standards), because the park seems like a great place to go for a walk along the water. There were a couple people there selling ice cream and stuff too. Go check it out if you can.

Beautiful. Was taken here by our tuck-tuck driver. What a fantastic little castle. Didn't have time to look inside but I love a castle and this one is so cute. What amused me was the little bit of beach near it. Great little place

Iconic feature of Lisboa. The tower itself was amazing. But also he walk along the riverside from it was interesting with the panels of historical facts and events. The walk ends at an aircraft monument commemorating the first flight from Lisbon to Brazil.

Should be better. This is a lovely monument, but it just feels disappointing as it is so full of tourists and surrounded by a not particularly nice area. Interesting enough, it just feels let down by the area.

This is where it all began. This is the place from where the navigators started their journeys. It's a must! At the same time, it was also a fortress, part of the awesome defense system protecting the entrance of the Tagus river.

Worth Climbing to the top. Sitting on the Tagus River this stone edifice was built as a defense to the river. A short climb to the first level is just a beginning to beautiful views of the river and Lisbon. A long, steep climb to the top is worth the effort as the panoramic views are spectacular. The sentry posts at each corner are a reminder of Arabic influence and offer excellent photo ops.
Was alright. Wouldn't make the trip for belem for this sight but worth popping by on the way to the monestary which is worth the €10 entry fee

The Torre de Belem: A Symbolic Gateway to Portugal.. The Torre de Belem is quite impressive and I heard that to many people, this tower is considered a symbolic gateway to Portugal. The 16th-century tower is considered one of the principal works of the Portuguese Late Gothic Manueline style. It has elaborate vaulting, crosses of the Order of Christ, armillary spheres and twisted rope, common to the nautically-inspired Manueline style.The building's plan is a rectangular tower, an irregular, hexagonal bastion surrounding it, with elongated flanks, that projects out into the river. It's cool to visit while you are in Portugal, even if it is just to get up close to see the architectural details.

Fantastic views. As its popular with coach parties if you don't want to queue too long, go after lunch. The tower is beautifully preserved and the view from the tower across the Tagus is amazing - €6 a bargain
Interesting place. Historically Rich. Beautiful place, by the river with a fantastic view, a must visit if you're visiting Lisbon. Easy access.

Well worth a visit!. We had to queue for about 20 minutes to get our tickets, you can prebuy on their website which may be a good idea for those in a hurry! There are a fair number of steps to climb to the tower, but it is worth it.

Great day in Belem. The Torre is well worth a visit. It is steeped in Potuguese trading history and the entire river front is a great walk. Stop for a beer at the cafe near the military museum and soak up the atmosphere. The Torre is very photogenic!

overrated. It's a small tower with a few interesting details and a nice view of the river (you get much better views from the many miradoros around the city). If you just feel like a pleasant walk along Tejo on a sunny day with some destination in mind - go for it.
Good views. Great views impressive structure. Nothing much to see inside though. I would go up the tower only if I had time. I could see a lot better uses of my time.

Challenging outside, disappointing inside!. After waiting in a cue to access this very challenging monument for almost 1 hour, we found ourselves a little bit disappointed afterwards: of course there is a historical and cultural story which is told by this monument, however there is not much to discover, besides a very nice view over the city and the river Taag!

A must see. Beautiful tower, clever architecture and wonderful views of the Tagus river and the southern part of Lisbon from the ramparts and the tower. One could skip the (slightly longer) queue at the tower, by buying the combined ticket at the Jeronimos monastery.
Piece of beauty. Built in Manuelin style, this beautiful fortress is located nearby Jeronimos Monastery. Another must see site
Must-See Tower. We really enjoyed this visit. We arrived early and avoided a lot of hassles. The view was wonderful and the whole experience is not to be missed.

Wonderful place. One of the most beautiful places in Lisbon, there is so much history written here, it’s a must visit place outside and inside. The weather was cloudy and rainy, that make the whole scenery even better outside. If you go there, don’t just stay for a bit, explore the whole area, there is a lot to see and learn.

A Historical Building in Lisbon. It is worth to visit even the tower is not big. It was classified by UNESCO as "Cultural Heritage of Humanity", which represents the history of Portugal. And, it was built on the edge of the river. I enjoyed so much walking along the river and viewed this famous architectural building. It was a wonderful experience!!!

Wonderful views. A wonderful climb up to a fantastic views of Lisbon and Torre River .
Very historical and well worth a visit .
Beautiful. Beautiful watch tower, didnt go in as you have to pay but didnt see the need as there is nothing inside.

A must see in Lisbon!!. We went here on our tour day, we hopped on one the bus tours and rode around Lisbon for the day. We knew we were going here because it was already on the must see list. I for one love this place, but I also enjoy old castles, forts and any other thing that has centuries of history involved. There was about an hour wait in line, but it was also cheaper because we had a discount with the Lisboa Card. It was well worth the wait, you got to climb the stone spiral staircase up to the top of the tower. The views were amazing and as you walked up floor to floor there is information on the history of the rooms and also the tower. If you like old towers, castles and history this is a must to do while in Lisbon.

Impressive! . Very old, impressive and well maintained tower, don't miss it! But the view from the Padrão dos Descobrimentos is apparently better and the lines for the tower are huge. We preferred to come on a Monday, when the tower is closed, and take beautiful photos from the outside without the queues and the crowds. Worked perfect that way!
beautiful. In addition to the Tower, which is a fabulous piece of architecture and history, lots of nice space for a picnic.

A beautiful building ruined by queues. We bought a joint ticket to the tower with the Mosteiro dos Jeronimos - I would recommend doing this if you intend to visit both as it saves some money and, more importantly, time queuing. Even better, book your ticket online before visiting to save queuing for a ticket all. After the monastery, we found the tower a little anti-climatic. It was nice enough to take a look at but maybe not worth the money to go in. We did enjoy the view from the top of the tower but there was a very silly and inefficient queuing system that prevented you from exploring at your own pace. Unless you're certain that you want to go inside, I would just take a stroll round and look from the outside.

Great historic sight. A fascinating and well preserved piece of history. There are lots of billboards nearby where you can read all about it and take in quite a bit without actually having to pay to go inside. It's quite majestic and wild as the waves crash against it in it's little inlet. Sadly the part of town that has developed around the area isn't nearly as charming. A freeway, and strip mall kind of feel.

Torre De Belém. I'm a history buff so visiting this awesome place was a must for me. A very beautiful location with spectacular views of the Torre. A lot of photo opportunities at different angles. Word to the wise, get there early and you must wear very comfortable walking shoes/sneakers. The streets, and they are narrow, are made out of cobblestones.

Worth a visit. Torre de Belem is situated in Belem and is easily reached by bus. We started at Mosterio dos Jeronimo, walked to the Padrão dos Descobrimentos and then to Torre de Belem. Very relaxing walk along the river!

A beautiful defensive building.. I admired the purpose and style of this building (there was another one across the river) which provided crossfire if any hostile ship would try to enter the river and threaten the city. Very interesting and pleasant to look at.

Terribly organised, waste of time.. This attraction is pointless. You spend 20 minutes queueing to get in and then queue the whole time in there due to the one-way stair system. There's little to see and engage with physically within the Tower and the views are mediocre at best. Without the queueing it's worth about 5 minutes of your time which isn't justified by the 6 euro cost.

Historic Fort. Although not a very large fort, Torre de Belem was built for the main purpose of protecting Lisbon from invasions back in the 1500's, a larger fort was built in later years.
It is a distinctive monument for the city, it was the last thing explorers saw when they left Lisbon and the first when they returned home.

only if you have time to kill in belem. The tour is not that interesting and the logistics are bad, causing a very long wait. The view is nice but it looks like the view from the discoverers monument is better.
It is one of the place to be visiting in Lisbon. Torre de Belem is one of the landmark of Lisbon, most of the transportation could be reached there. It is one of the place to be visiting in Lisbon.
Cultural History at its best. Cultural History at its best. The architecture is beautiful and our guide gave us some great insights into the construction and use of this fort.

Fabulous Architecture. Built on the north shore of the Tagus River in the 16th Century as part of the fortifications for Lisbon. It comprises a tower and bastion and is a UNESCO World Heritage Site.Expect some long queues during busy times and lots of stairs. Being just off-shore the views of the surrounding coastline is impressive. Didn't have time to wait for a tour inside, but subsequent discussions with those that did reported very impressive architecture on the inside.
Fascinating history. The Belem Tower and the history of the area is fascinating. However, there are very aggressive people selling scarves, selfie sticks and trinkets, ,so prepare yourself.

Very nice view . It is located next to the sea. A very old watch tower of ancient days. There is draw bridge that could cut off enemy if there is intrusion. There is groove that soldier could pour hot oil to wade of enemy who tried to climb the wall. Visitor could see what is in a movie in this ancient place. Long queue but worth the effort. Great place to visit if you are fan of movie with ancient scene such as Lord of the Ring and such; and have time to queue up.

Not unmissable. The tower itself isn't very high though there is a good view at the top, if you are going to the monastery anyway pay an extra 2€ for it, otherwise go and enjoy the park next to the river, have a drink and enjoy the view that way. Gratis :)

Icon of Portugal/Lisbon. Iconic building of Lisbon. Very pretty and ornate inside. (However inside some of the turrets (?) quite a lot of people have written their names etc., very disrespectful and would not be tolerated at any other monument of this calibre).The queue was fairly long unsurprisingly and we found the staff quite dismissive and clinical and just generally not very nice. Very weird for a world standard UNESCO World Heritage Site. Overall, though, it was a nice experience and one of the must-do attractions in Lisbon (a lot of steps!)

A masterpiece of architecture and strategy. Try to notice the details of this strategic tower built to defend Lisbon. The Tower of Belem is one of the strategic towers built at the entrance of the river. If possible, visit the last level.
Beautiful building and scenary. We stopped at torre de Belem on the hop on-hop of bus tour. We did not go inside as the queue was long, but the scenery and the building is beautiful!

Excellent. This was a beautiful building and the views were spectacular. Got in with visitor card for free! Area around it was lovely but a bit of a walk to get there. The queues were lengthy but well worth it, just be aware lots of steps to climb.

National Coach Museum. This museum apparently just opened in a new location. A great collection of coaches. Large building that could handle crowds. The collection is fascinating and one of the best in the world. We enjoyed looking at the beautiful craftsmanship. Well worth a visit. Always ask for a seniors ticket rate if applicable.
Nice to visit. Ok to visit -- but not much to see and not worth paying for it - ok for a Sunday free visit. And, that said, it's an impressive structure.

Great site for a picnic!. Take some time and enjoy the day here. There is a small cafe and a large grassy area that meets the water, down the few stairs. Most of the tour buses will travel to this site.

Manueline fantasies. Another remarkable example of Manueline architecture and an evocative reminder of the great days of exploration when it was the navigators' last sight of Lisbon on departure and their first on return.
Beautiful . Beautiful ares in Lisbon great scenery. That area is surrounded with a lot of the must see places in Lisbon .
Torre de Belem. Takes a long time to get get to the top of the Torre,first the long queue to the entrance,then extra queues to the top as the steps are very narrow.

Nice place to go on a beautiful day!. Interesting construction but more then that the scenery is beautiful. It gives you a good view of the river and the surrounding . There is not much else to see. I suggest you should go there on your way to the Sao Geronimo Church and Monasterio.

Long, long queues to climb this Tower. I had intended to go up the Tower after having visited the Monasterio, but there were SO many people endeavouring to do the same thing, that I gave up!With that in mind, I only took pictures of the exterior so cannot make a valued judgement on this attraction. Instead I walked along the coastline to see the area.The answer seems to be - get there as early as possible - to make the climb to the top of the Tower.
From here boats sailed to conquer the unknown world. This tower is the main symbol of an ancient history of conquers of the portuguese. From here boats sailed to conquer the unknown world.
Cute town. Belem was a beautiful little town with quite a few things to do. The monestary isn't open on Mondays but was still beautiful to look at. Everything is relatively close.

Impressive. Impressive and beautiful from outside, great views from the tower itself, less impressive inside, no exibitions and a very small overpriced gift shop. well worth the visit if combined with other attractions in the combo tickets.
Wonderful views. Visited mid week/mid day and the crowds were minimal. The views of the river were impressive and it was cool to explore the various turrets. A must see while in the area.
Must see in Lisbon. The Belem Tower is a must see when in Lisbon. It is an iconic symbol and it is in a lovley area by the sea and is also close to other attractions.

A lot of people. It a very interesting building from the outside.
There are always people in line in order to enter.
In fact they put a light for people to pass inside the tower!
A bit of a disappointment. On the plus side the building has stood the test of time quiet well. On the downside there isn't much to see once inside the tower.

Nice view from outside.. The view is really nice: by the river, at the sunset... Worth to stay outside (nothing really interesting from inside that worth to pay to see it). Easy to find, not so easy to park (Arrive early). Few minutes walk to others monuments.
Its a nice place to see . Its a nice place to see but not worth money. You dont have to go inside as there are many other places in Lisbon with a better view. Nothing special.
Iconic landmark. It is the undoubtedly lisbon's most iconic landmark. It is the must see destination in lisbon. I highly recommend this place.

A quick look. You can get here on tram no 15, it's a must see in Lisbon. Very nice area and opportunity for some good photos as well. You have to queue to go up, we did not we just stayed around the area enjoyed the feel and relaxed

Great architecture with great view. Came here on a Tuesday afternoon and the queue was already quite big so be prepared to wait! The tower itself is a great piece of architecture and design, tho if you aren't up for steep spiral staircases you will be limited to what you can see. The climb to the top is worth it for the view. As you ascend the stairs up the tower don't miss the first level as it has a balcony, the other floors don't have that.

Perfect view, and we loved the area. Had the best day here in Torre de Belem and the area near. We were here on a perfect sunny day, and you got perfect view in every angle. I love sailing, and see sailboat cruising by was perfect. If you walk ten minutes in direction of the city you find good fish resturants
Nice ...... We visited this tower as a part of sight seeing tour in Lisbon, a nice place to visit, no need to spend long in and around it.....

Interesting. Bring your camera! the views from the top are beautiful ! Not very crowded when we went. I guess we went too early. Very nice by the water to have your cafe and bolos de belem. Some how it taste better by the water. Interesting workmanship ! The people who carved this monument had talent and a lot of patients. So much detail went into this Tower.We went a few times. Not to miss!

Just a tower, nothing very special. I truly believe it has a value only for local Portuguese people as is a sign of their great history. Comapred to the other towers of the world nothing really special, only that it is on the coast of the water.

Lisbon environs. Very interesting part of the Lisbon experience, accessed by tram or as a part of an organised tour. Nearby attractions (including the monastery) and great restaurants make this a "must see" destination.
Not worth entering . The tower is very nice from outside but not worth entering. No information displayed inside and is not particulary cheap.

Great tower. This tower is a great architecture. Located at the river bank. Enjoying the great building while enjoying the sea breeze. It is a quite far from the train station, suggest to use cab or bus to be there. Not able to visit the inside of tower as was late during our visiting.
A jewel of Manuelin style. A small lovely building from the XVI century, in white stone almost surrounded by the Tejo river. It' a very nice area to walk, close to the river.
Unique tower. Seldom see a tower being built right on the banks of a river. Did not get the tickets to visit the interior as it's too expensive.

Unique tower. This tower is really a nice piece of architecture, very impressive. I found that it's better to look at it from outside then the visit inside. The ticket cost was very cheap so still worth it to go inside.

Wow!. Climbing the 93 steps to the top and looking around was a wonderful experience. Going down to view what was once space for political prisoners gave me a real sense of how short people were in the 1500's; I consider myself short at 5'2", but felt like a giant down there! The modest admission of 6€ for adults and 3€ for seniors is great, too.

Well worth it. Loved this place. The setting is wonderful. A few annoying people trying to sell you things when you get there. There are lots of stairs (spiral staircase), and the system to move up and down didn't work very well, but a stunning piece of architecture. I wouldn't have wanted to have been an enemy ship or indeed locked up there as a political enemy in Portugal's past. Incredible.

Beautiful views from the top. Definitely worth going but not in the afternoon as there are long queues to get in. Go in the morning, if you take a train be prepared to walk about 3km to reach the tower, but it´s a nice walk. So if you don´t want to walk far, take a tram or bus which will get you closer to the sight. If you are 65+, you will have 50% reduction fee, if you show the passport.
Worth seeing. Enjoyed the history and the views from the tower. Long wait if you don't have tickets in advance. You can get them online.

Great view, most people seem unable to grasp how a stop lighs works. Much better than the waste of time the Jerónimos is. Great views from above and the terrace. Just watch out, most people can't seem to understand how a green and red light with a timer works. Also the Lisboa Card is a joke here, you still stand in line to get a 0 eur ticket instead of simply walking in.
Wonderful. Not to be missed, as well as Mosteiro dos Jeronimos. Together, in my opinion, they are the more important atractions in Lisbon. Long queues to get tickets, so try to buy them in advance.

Very pretty, but long queues. Went all the way to Belem to see the tower. Take public transport to Belem town, then a bit of a walk alone the shore line to the site. Very pretty, but the queues at the weekend are crazy so we ended up not going in. Worth the trip though if you have the time.
Unique Tower in the World. This tower has a unique decoration and ambient. This was already a prison, a control guard and now a museum and monument.

A must visit attraction in Lisbon. This building is beautiful and well worth a visit, even if you just view it from the outside. The number of people that can go inside at any one point is strictly limited so you might just want to take a photo or two, read the close-by history boards and then admire the other views of the Belem area. Do go and see this though - from the outside at least - it's a symbol of Lisbon and Portugal.

Wonderful!. Wonderful - this is like something from a children's fables book. You can just imagine some long haired damsel in distress leaning out of the top window. Lovely architectural details that looked especially gorgeous in the warm, early evening sunshine.It is a UNESCO World Heritage Site (along with the nearby Jerónimos Monastery).

Great from the outside; Awful from the inside. A lovely building to look at but don't bother going in. Its expensive, boring and you have to queue for or everything. You queue to buy your ticket, you queue to get up the stairs. I think I spend about 40 mins queuing to go to the top and about 5 at the top looking at the view then another 30 waiting to come back down again. A shocking waste of money and time on account of the only thing worth looking at is the the tower you are already in henceforth rendering the view from the top pretty boring.Save your money and time and sit in the park at the bottom for half an hour looking at the facade.
Eye opening structure. Interesting visit. The Torre is right on the river and has a great view. Long lines to get in so go early. Pics from top is great.

Nice place for a photostop. On our hop-on-hop-off tour through Lisbon, Belem tower is a good place to get off and shoot some photo's. It's beautifully situated in the water. It's also a museum and lots of people were in line to get in. We didn't. Much to beautiful weather to spend the day in dark buildings.
Beautiful Landmark. Another great landmark not to be missed while visiting Lisbon. Long lines outside in the summer though. Lots of other great things to see and do in the Belem area.

Beautiful piece of history. Beautiful tower in a beautiful surrounding. Not far from the Padrão dos Descobrimentos monument, so it is nice to walk from the tower to the monument or vice versa after lunch or dinner. :) You can go inside the tower aswell but we just chose not to. :)
.... . Good visit.. But the queues were horrendous... The tower is interesting in itself but hives very lovely views for the surrounding area.
Avoid peak season. Wayyy too busy in August. We didn't bother going in because the queue was crazy. Looks beautiful from the outside though.

Interesting monument but very busy. This is a defense tower by the Tagus river.It is very interesting in terms of understanding the functionality of the building.However, it is very poorly run and disorganized when it comes to the staff, that actually no d of discourages you to go up. There is a very narrow staircase and they don't control the traffic enough, causing big waiting times.
Have to see in Lisbon, but expensive. Beautiful castle with a beautiful 360 view of Lisbon. It's only relative expensive (8 Euro per person) but in the end worth it!

Gorgeous. Its like a small castle on the water. A great reminder of the Portuguese Discoveries Era and a great piece of architecture. I recommend going inside and taking pictures from the top. If you have the Lisboa Card, it's free. Just dont go on a Monday, they're closed.

Pasties de Belem. A good walk, great to see the history of the tower and surrounding area on the walk towards the tower.
Went there mainly to have pastis de belem at its origin. It was worth it.

Beautiful building...but only from the outside!!!. Torre de Belem is a must see attraction while you're in Lisbon and in my opinion it's enough to admire it and enjoy it from the outside. There's not need to waste time in long queue to get in because there's literally nothing to see inside. It's boring and it will make you disappointed. What will make your visit to Torre de Belem even more disappointing is if you try to climb the very top of it. Loooong queue to get up and loooong queue to get down. Views from the top are so boring that you'll wish to go down in 10 sec but you'll be stuck up there for much longer.So instead of paying to get in buy yourself a cold drink or an ice cream in beautiful park in front of Torre de Belem and enjoy the views!P.S. it's even more beautiful at night. Great sight. Belem has a few attractions and this is definitely one of the most impressive ones. Some great photo opportunities and again offers an insight in to the history of the city and surrounding area. Must see.
Don't go in!. The cellar used to be a prison and now the roof is! Seriously you spend half an hour getting up for not a great view and it takes even longer getting down.Lovely building outside!

I highly recommend Francisco and Sandeman. Great tour did the free tour then paid for the Belem tour and pub crawl. Fransisco was very friendly. Supper . We haven't been inside as queue was amazingly long. However the outside place looks as well as in the postcards I have seen.

Boring and not worth the price!. Best to just look at this from afar and from the outside. There is nothing to see in the Torre. It's definitely not worth the €6 entry fee and the hour-long queue! You get a nice view from the top but it's not good enough to be worth the climb up. The climb itself is "organised" via a traffic light system but it's not very efficient and just annoying. don't bother with going to the top. very beautiful historic building, enough to see from the outside or the first upper level. Don't bother going up to the top, the long winding staircase and massive queue to get down is not worth it.

Really little to see from the inside or from the various levels that can be accessed from the stairs. Stay outside, take photos, have a beer at one of the outdoor cafes. You will be happy you did.

Not very well organised!. Found ourselves with a massive queue, 93 steps to the top and very little time left before it closed at 5pm. Chickened out after less than 30 steps as felt very traumatic. Maybe if we were younger!!
Tower of Belem. The portuguese architecture of the XVI century has here one of its most noticeable monuments, which UNESCO has considered World Heritage

Beautiful view across the Targus River. Beautiful site with a view across the Targus river at Porto Brandao and the bridge of April 524th. We passed it by on the hop on hop off bus and I regret not having gotten off to take a closer look.
Fabulous view over Tagus River, 25th April Bridge and Santuário Nacional de Cristo Rei. You should definitely visit this wonderful tourist attraction. There is a fabulous view when reaching the top.
Interesting monument . Very interesting morning monument which seem to be struggling to remain in pristine condition. It is probably the victim of its own success
Beautiful. Amazing tower, fantastic arquitecture. The view is marvelous! The area is very good for walking. Do not know the inside, only saw it from the outside
Nice to see.. Nice to see. Nice view on the top. Historical monument in Lisbon, Portugal. An epic tour to the time of discouvers.

Pleasant visit but.... nice view, but that's it. View of tower from outside: beautifulView from top of tower: magnificentTicket price to get to the top: to highWaiting time: annoying...

Mis-represented. While the Torre is undoubtedly a great piece of architecture and history within the area of Belem, the queue that led it was very poorly organised.We waited for over an hour in the queue while many people pushed passed claiming to have pre-purchased tickets despite all the information we and others around us had to say that Sunday is free (turns out this is only the first of the month).Once inside, the first floor is simply a space for you to see many cannons looking out onto the same views. In an open location that is worth seeing. The tower itself is in a nice location that is very open and not surrounded by anything. There are lots of photo opportunities as the scenery is nice with the river Tejo behind the tower. Go early in the morning when entry is easier.
If you visiting Lisbon is a must !. Queue was a bit too long and were short on time, but if you have time to enter it do so, take a a round inside and and get to the top for a stunning view

iconic view in Lisbon. Breathtaking setting, nice to view at sunset or sunrise, worth the extra trip from the city, can be made together with the monastery

Great view. Really the best view in Lisabon, just try to get there early morning, after there is too much people and crowded. If you plan to visit Monastery too, buy one ticket together. Wonderfull :)

Highlight attraction of Lisbon. Without a doubt this is one of the highlight attractions of Lisbon. It can be busy if you want to get in so allow enough time. It's also a good spot for taking photos. Really special. Torre de Belem is really special, like it was made of sand, usually served as a main defense of the city.

Not worth a lot of time. Be sure to get your ticket for this as part of the combination ticket for the Jeronimos Monastery. The Grand Old Duke of York. Logically there's a limit of something like 150 allowed in the tower at any one time; 'logically' because there's only a single staircase allowing visitors to go up five odd floors or come down them.. When, presumably greed, persuades organisers to allow far more than that number into the tower, you inevitably end up with 2-3 hundred visitors understandably irritated at having to be badly herded like sheep through a system not ever designed to cope with such numbers. Beautiful monument.. This was a great place to visit. Lovely location of course, and the monument is majestic. A very high circular staircase, another great feature - so worth the visit. Beautiful.

good view, average tourist activity. Visited the tower in August on a Thursday afternoon and there was not a queue. One rectangular viewing platform with high walls so shouldn't be a problem with kids climbing over, but they wouldn't be able to see without being lifted. The view is impressive and I was glad to have made the visit, it is quite a simple tourist activity but worth experiencing if you are near.

The 15th century last stronghold of Tagus River. The Tagus river depended on the Fortresses of Cascais and São Sebastião (Caparica) its defense, which led to the construction of a new stronghold, closer to Lisbon, to defend the entrance to the river Tagus.Finished in 1519-1520, Belém tower was used as a lighthouse, telegraph post, dungeons for political convicts. In 1831, it played its role at the Battle of the Tagus during the Liberal Wars.Apart from its immense history, it is a beautiful tower located next to the Tagus river and at the entrance to Lisbon. Take an afternoon in Belém and visit the Tower, you will not regret it!Inside you will find all kind of remarks of its 500 years history and plentiful usages throughout the time, namely the cannons for its defense, dungeons, ...Regardless if for the amazing place or if for its history, Visiting Lisbon requires visiting Belém's tower. Don't think twice!
day in belem. day at belem was stunning went back twice lovely walk and plent places to stop for something to eat a great day out

Magnificent Age of Discovery Structure. So very Portuguese, in its boldness and its stature. The shot that everyone wants to get of the Lisbon waterfront. Pretty cool for photographing. Loved the location of this and got some really great pictures. Nice to be on the waterfront. This was used as a fortress for protection. Nice park nearby

Incredible inside and out. During our romantic weekend away in Lisbon visiting this incredible monument was one of the highlights of our stay. Fantastic views over Lisbon and the river/sea.
